item.title: Chinese company builds access to Inhambane and Porto da Beira
item.description: Mozambican Transport and Logistics Minister João Jorge Matlombe told Lusa that Mozambique will sign contracts with a Chinese company to build access roads to Inhambá and Porto da Beira. Matlombe explained that he will sign the contracts today, one involving “direct financing” and another a public-private partnership (PPP), with the China Road and Bridge Corporation (CRBC) state group. CRBC will build a road with almost 78 kilometers to improve access to Inhambane province in southern Mozambique, which the minister described as “an important tourist zone”. Matlombe has assumed that the cost of the project "will even be assumed by the state itself", since "there is no demand that justifies a PPP or a direct direct investment." On the contrary, the leader argued that, according to a study already conducted, ”the road to Porto da Beira,“ from the point of view of the business model, allows any investor to recover his investment ”. The minister stressed that Porto da Beira“ is one of the largest in the south of the country ”and that the new access will be“ an alternative corridor ”that will facilitate, for example,“ the departure of Porto ”for the vicin. Encounters in Macau The minister spoke on the sidelines of a session of the 16th International Forum and Exhibition on Investment Investment and Construction (IIICF), which is taking place until Thursday in Macao. Matlombe has revealed that he already has at least five meetings in Macao with members of the government of Botsuana, Angola, Cape Verde and Democratic Republic of Congo (RDCongo). On the table will be the logistics corridor in the North Zone, which connects Maláui, Zambia and RDCongo, to “capitalize the use of the port of Nacala”, said the leader. Matlombe revealed that the Minister of Public Works, Housing and Mozambican Water Resources, Fernando Rafael, also traveled to the region. The head of the protection of transport and logistics said that during the stay in Macao, the government colleague "will also sign some agreements for the social housing mass for young people."

item.title: Public Management | Totality of companies evaluated with notes above B
item.description: The Directorate of Services of Supervision and Management of Public Assets (DSSGAP) has evaluated with positive note all MSar companies with public capitals. On a scale of 0 to 100 points, there were no evaluated with a note below 70 points. None of the companies got the maximum grade, but CAM-Macao International Airport Society and the Society for the Development of Macao Industrial Parks were evaluated with “A-”, which means a note between 80 and 84 points. Most companies evaluated obtained a score greater than 75 points, but less than 80, which means a B+scale. This was the case of Umacert Investigation and Engineering Tests, Macao Urban Renewal, Macao, Investment and Development Securities Settlement and Settlement Center, S.A., Macao Science Center, Macao Orchestra Society, Macau Slaughterhouse, Macao Metro Society and TDM - Macao Teledifusion. Finally, the companies with worst evaluation went to UmTec and the Macao World Trade Center, whose final grade was a “B”, which represents an assessment of at least 70 points and a maximum of 74 points. The evaluation of the results of exploitation and operation results from the obligation imposed by the legal regime of public capital companies to evaluate these companies annually. Evaluations take into account different criteria, according to the nature and objectives of the evaluated companies. "Among the indicators of the exploitation and operation performance assessment of the year 2024, the essential indicator for all companies was the management performance, paying attention to the rationality and regularity of establishing the governance structure, the completeness of the establishment of internal management regimes, the exploitation in accordance with the law, as well as the regularity of information dissemination," was indicated by DSSGAP.

item.title: Typhoon | First storm of the year with signal 1 this morning
item.description:
A low pressure area that was yesterday in the center of the Southern Sea of ​​China will intensify on the way to Hainan Island and the West Coast of Guangdong at the end of the week. Meteorological and geophysical services will be a sign 1 of tropical storm, the first of the year, this morning
Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) will be the first sign 1 of the 2025 Tropical Storm. In a statement published yesterday, when the storm was 810 kilometers from Macao, the SMG indicated that a “low pressure area located in the central seasion of southern China intensified to a tropical depression”, moving slowly “to regions between the island of the island of Hainan and the West Zone of Guangdong ”. Given that the forecast points to the tropical depression to continue to develop in the coming days, due to its influence, “it is expected that the wind intensifies in Macao later this week”, and that the territory be beaten by frequent and thunderstormdas. The SMG guarantee that they will continue to follow the evolution of the first storm of the Tuphal time, and appealed to the population that "paying attention to the latest weather information, adopting preventive measures in time." Bonanza Times Prior to the approach of the storm to the Guangdong coast, the SMG estimates that during this day the weather remains very hot, despite the descent of three degrees of the maximum temperature compared to yesterday to 32 degrees. The sky will be very cloudy interval of periods of little cloudy. The scenario changes tomorrow, with the thunder, thunderstorms and generally cloudy sky. According to the China Meteorological Agency, tropical depression will go west at a speed of 10 kilometers per hour. Since predictions point to increased intensity, national authorities do not rule out the possibility of depression becoming this year's first typhoon. The point of contact with the earth is expected to take place on Friday. The agency also added that the formation time of this year's first typhoon was later than usual and that in previous years, by this time, the number of storms would surround an average of 2.7. The Hong Kong Observatory also announced yesterday that it would go today to the tropical storm sign 1 and that tomorrow would evaluate the need to increase the alert sign. Speaking to the broadcaster RTHK, an official from the Hong Kong Observatory did not risk predicting the impact of the storm on the neighboring region, due to the multitude of factors involved. "In addition to the distance to Hong Kong, the impact also depends on its strength at the time [where it passes through the region]. The cyclone's wind field structure will also affect the wind force and the amount of rain it will bring," said Sha Chi-Tai.

item.title: IAM / Portal | Update eliminates about 20 years of statistics
item.description:
By eliminating the data, AMI caused access to information as to the one that reveals that in 2023 and 2024 there was a peak of animal slaughter. HM tried to get clarification, but had no answer yet
The Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) updated the portal with data on the number of animals slaughtered and took the opportunity to fail to present the statistics of about 20 years. HM tried to get clarification on the reason for eliminating the data, but despite an email sent to four advisers on May 25, until yesterday I had not received any response, nor even confirmation of receiving email. In the past, before the recent update, those who visited the AMI portal about the number of slaughtered animals could not only realize the number of dogs of dogs and cats per month, but also had access to a history over 20 years. The older data between 2003 and 2007 were less complete, as they only had the total of animals slaughtered without discrimination if the animals were canine or feline. However, all these data are no longer available, without providing any explanation of the decision to stop making the data available to the population. In addition, according to the new presentation, it is no longer possible to follow the trends in the slaughtering of animals in the territory. This is due to the fact that they would have started to present the data by quarter instead of presenting per month. General cleaning The elimination of data arises at a time when the government argues to be implementing a policy of “capture, sterilization and adoption” of street animals rather than resorting to slaughter. This was a policy requested for several years by animal protection associations as an alternative to the number of slaughter. However, between 2023 and 2024 the number of slaughter grew. The elimination of the data also makes the peak of feline deaths disappeared from the statistics recorded in the first half of 2023, when only 105 cats were slaughtered in six months. In terms of canine deaths, the elimination of statistics shows how the year with the highest number of slaughter was 2024, last year, when AMI eliminated a total of 311 dogs. However, this number is less than half of what was happening in 2010, the year with the highest canine mortality according to the statistics erased by the AMI, when 718 occurrences were recorded. In light of the new official statistics, the number of cat slaughter in 2023 and 2024 was 140 and 119, respectively. In terms of dogs, the numbers show a climb, with 220 slaughter in 2023 and 311 slaughter in 2024. In the first half of the year, there were 32 cat slaughter and 69 dogs.

item.title: Culture | Wu zhiliang wants background to ensure national security
item.description:
The president of the Macau Foundation considers that the government must have a mechanism to ensure national security and patriotism in culture. As such, Wu Zhiliang defends the creation of a fund to promote national narratives in literature and the arts in general and the establishment of legal balances between freedom of expression and national security
Macau Foundation's chairman of the Macau Foundation, Wu Zhiliang, understands that the territory is facing challenges that cannot be neglected and that even in culture should be lower in defense of state security and nationalism. In a speech given Monday in Beijing at the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, Wu Zhiliang defended the creation of a mechanism that ensures national security and the promotion of nationalism in culture and the arts. Thus, the leader of the Macau Foundation, who finances, among others, cultural projects, understands that it is necessary to create a special background to promote nationalist narratives in literature and the other arts. To ensure that there are no violations of the law and the rights of residents, Wu Zhiliang suggested a bet on regional cooperation to gather efforts between Macao, Hong Kong and China's law schools. The objectives of the partnership would create a system of legal interpretation, with analysis of typical cases to define standards of balance between freedom of expression and national security. The partnership could also be extended to other areas of education, for example, with the establishment of a platform for sharing education resources resource resource intended for national security in the Great Bay, with a view to promoting an immersive learning model. Muscular response The intervention in the cultural area is viewed by the president of the Macau Foundation as a way of responding to the challenges that the MSAR currently faces, indicated in Beijing, without specifically realized. The official highlighted the social environment and cultural bases of the population as elements that not only demonstrate the effectiveness of governance in Macao, but guarantee national security through the deep articulation of social structure and cultural values. To this end, Wu Zhiliang highlighted the fundamental role played by the principle “One country, two systems”, whose success also depends on Macao's unique social environment, as well as the solid cultural identity. In addition to the application of the political principle, the official highlighted the improvement of the well-being of the population, the education system and the role played by the associative fabric. Wu Zhiliang particularly highlighted patriotic associations, and their social service networks that cover the entire city, which promote activities related to national security. In this regard, the leader gave as an example the mobilization that the associations achieved, taking about three thousand people to participate in the sessions of public consultation, when changes to the law relating to the defense of state security in 2023.

item.title: Portugal | Luís Montenegro visits Macau and China in September
item.description:
The Portuguese Prime Minister plans to visit China in September, which will be the first visit of the Portuguese Government Head of Government since 2016, when António Costa was in the Chinese capital. The news was advanced by Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, who admitted not to come to Macau until the end of his term
The president of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, returned a return to Macau on Monday, but announced that Prime Minister Luís Montenegro is expected to go through the MSar in September during a visit to China. The Chief of Staff of Portugal spoke to journalists in Lagos, in the district of Faro, where he arrived on Monday to the June 10 celebrations, which according to the original program would continue in Macao, a trip that was in the meantime. "It was scheduled for Macau. But one could not go to Macau because we have to be on 12 [June] to celebrate the entrance to Europe. How did we go to Macao? Interrogated if he will still go to Macau in his second and last presidential term, which will end on March 9 next year, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa replied: "No. Go Prime Minister, if you can, but further forward in September." "While I go to the United Nations, he goes to Macao, China. Because he has a visit to China that also was around Macao. Let's see if he can score, while I'm in New York, he takes the opportunity to go to Macau and China," he added. Canceled celebrations Following the cancellation of Portugal Day celebrations in Macao, following the fall of the PSD/CDS-PP government in March, and the convening of early legislative elections to May 18, no celebration of this date was not foreseen. However, the President of the Republic and Prime Minister Luís Montenegro eventually celebrated June 10 in Germany, on Saturday, with the Portuguese community in Stuttar, before watching the victory of Portugal in the final of the League of Nations, on Sunday night, against Spain, in Munich. Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa made a state visit to the Popular Republic of China between April and May 2019, which began in Beijing, where he was received by President XI Jinping, passed by Shanghai and ended in the Special Administrative Region of Macao. EYES IN THE FUTURE Amelia António, president of the House of Portugal, considered that the view of Luís Montenegro Macau is more important than the visit of Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, since the prime minister will stay in office, while the president is leaving. "In a way it is understood, it would be a kind of farewell from Marcelo, in the end of mandate. But, if it is much more important, from a diplomatic and political point of view, to come from a prospect of walking forward," said Amelia Antónia, in statements to Radio Macau.

item.title: June 10 | Alexandre Leitão highlights the end of the waiting lists at the Consulate
item.description:
Yesterday was held at the consular residence in Bela Vista, the usual celebration ceremony of June 10-Portugal, Camões and the Portuguese Communities. Alexandre Leitão, Consul, highlighted the end of the waiting lists in the consulate and the modernization of some services, noting that Portugal is ready to promote stronger economic ties with the MSAR
After years when renewing the citizen card or passport could be a small major problem for Portuguese citizens to reside in the MSAR, since this subject seems to be solved. Alexandre Leitão, Portuguese consul-general in Macao and Hong Kong, proved yesterday to be a satisfied man to talk about the last achievements achieved in the operation of the Portuguese Consulate-General in Macau and Hong Kong, this regards the June 10th, Portugal, Camões and Portuguese Communities celebrations. "After two years of intense concentration in the normalization of consular services, we eliminated waiting lists in the field of issuing citizen cards and passports," he said. According to Alexandre Leitão, "users have returned access to 90 percent of services without prior appointment, we introduced electronic payment, we drastically reduce response and referral times after the admission of processes, and reorganize human resources and procedures." The consul did not forget the consulate's team, "which is constituted, almost in full, by Macanese who have positively reacted to the successive challenges that have been presented to them", also noting that "in 15 months were emitted or renewed 55 thousand cards of citizen and passports, which also demonstrates the dimension of the Portuguese community of Macau and Hong Kong." Portugal with value Thus, the official said he could “safely say that the essential, from the strictly consular point of view, is done”, but intends to bet on the “deepening of Portugal's diplomatic, economic and cultural relations with the special administrative regions” of Macao and Hong Kong. Addressing the Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai, Alexandre Leitão recalled that the ruler “has defended the acceleration of the opening and diversification of the economy” and that from this point of view Portugal has a privileged role to fulfill. "Portugal has the same purpose, which makes us, once again, bridged in a common purpose: to grow and diversify our economies, internationalizing them for the benefit of our peoples. Portuguese companies are prepared to take advantage of the" most open and inclusive posture to intensify international ties and increase global projection and attractiveness and the renowned Macao as an international metropolis "," Since, they are aware of the contribution of Portuguese companies and workers to the growth and quality of Macao economy services ”. The consul was still clear in saying Sam Hou Fai that "he can count on the Portuguese community to actively participate in the ambitious design of economic diversification of Masters." Alexandre Leitão did not forget the last major Chinese investment in Portugal, namely in Sines, by Calb - China Aviation Lithium Battery, being “the largest of the decade”, which “demonstrates the confidence of large Chinese companies and the quality and capacity of Portugal as the preferential investment destination”. Camões, the Great Given that there are numerous celebrations of the 500th anniversary of the birth of Luís Vaz de Camões, Sam Hou Fai brought the Portuguese poet to his speech at yesterday's ceremony in Bela Vista. “The strong and deep historical ties between Portugal and Macau are already known to all, and are reflected on this day, because today is also celebrating the largest Portuguese poet who lived a few years in Macao and was part of the first moments of this historical meeting of two peoples.” "It is never too much to remember that it is because of this centenary meeting of cultures, in this" outdoor window "of China, that the" uniqueness "of Macao arises as" the only place in the world whose official languages ​​", as expressly underlined by President XI Jinping," said the chief executive. Sam Hou Fai has not yet forgotten the “commitment and commitment of the Government of MSA in the concentration of efforts to build a higher level opening platform”, as well as the “reinforcement of bilateral opening with Lusophony and promoting comprehensive mutual benefits cooperation that enriches and further widen the role and functions of Macao as a sino-illusion platform”. The chief executive's words also referred to the defense “Macao's multicultural characteristics” and promoting “development in all strands, seeking to continually ensure and improve the well-being of all residents of Macao, including Portuguese communities in Macao”.

item.title: FRC | Lúcia Lemos today presents the exhibition “metamorphoses”
item.description:
As an integral part of the June 10th celebrations poster - Portugal, Camões and the Portuguese Communities, the Rui Cunha Foundation hosts, from today, the show “Metamorphoses”, by Lúcia Lemos. The show makes a retropective work of the photographer, artist and former director of Creative Macau
The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) today presents, from 18h, the exhibition “Metamorphoses”, by Lúcia Lemos, which makes a retrospective of its artistic path, with works and compositions of different genres. The event is inserted in the program of the festivities of “June, Portugal's month at MSAR”. “Metamorphoses” brings together 44 pieces that link diverse artistic expressions and aesthetics, such as engraving, photography, installation, painting and ceramics. Lucia Lemos uses organic materials to body ideas, and meanings to her art, in the different languages ​​and forms she has been experiencing and learning throughout life, now with greater freedom and time to explore. The show emerges from “lived transformations and personal visual observations of the physical space - Macau - where I allowed myself to contaminate, never fail to practice portugality, as a sense of belonging from the place from which I departed four decades ago”, reflects the artist, cited in a FRC note. Lúcia Lemos recently retired from the Creative Macau project that founded in August 2003. A kind of symbiosis According to Lúcia Lemos, the retrospective that now exposes to the public also means the symbiosis of construction and maturation of its “identity, modeled by the changes in adaptation and adoption to the metamorphosis of the new place”. "Art and the artistic process are seeking forms of integration and connection of the human being into the nature and the world around him," he added. Lúcia Lemos built a professional career that crossed various arts and aesthetics, having started by obtaining an arts management diploma in 2001. Subsequently, he installed the Creative Macau Center for Creative Industries, which coordinated for over 20 years, and launched the Macao International Short Festival. Participated in more than 50 collective exhibitions in Macau and other places, with some award -winning works and varied artistic languages. Since 2002, he has individually displayed black and white photography in Berkeley, Curitiba, Lisbon, Macau, Monza, Palermo, Porto, Salzburg and Shanghai. The show will be evident until June 21st.

item.title: Commerce | Prolonged until December anti -dumping inquiry on European pork meat
item.description: The China Ministry of Commerce announced yesterday that it will last until December the investigation for unfair competition to imports of certain pig meat products from the European Union (EU), which began in June 2024. In a statement published on its official portal, the ministry justified the extent of the investigation “meeting the complexity of the case”, setting as a new deadline December 16. The inquiry, launched on June 17, 2024, initially had a one -year duration, with the possibility of extension “in special circumstances”, as it had already been signaled at the time. The investigation focuses on pork and offal, both refrigerated and frozen, as well as fat and derivatives, originating in the EU. Beijing began this measure as retaliation for customs imposed by Brussels on electric vehicles manufactured in China, claiming that state subsidies received by this sector create competition distortions against European brands. Despite tensions, in recent months there was a slight approximation between China and the EU, namely after the impact of the trade war began by US President Donald Trump. European Commerce Commissioner Maros Sefcovic, who visited China in March, recently said that Brussels and Beijing "share significant mutual interests in resolving bilateral and global challenges" and stressed that it is "equally important to face differences." According to the European official, the two parties are “working hard” to achieve advances before the bilateral summit scheduled for July, China, when the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between Beijing and Brussels will be celebrated.

item.title: PAULO MAIA AND CARMO
item.description: Du Mu (803-852), Chang'an's poet, who in his imperial employee career was sent in successive missions to distant posts of the capital, often showed his inconvenience in the face of repeated separations. In one of his most admired poems he looked at the old narrative told since the Han Dynasty, which explains a traditional festival celebrated on the seventh day of the seventh moon, where once a year the meeting of a couple, cowboy Niulang and weaver Zhinu, identified with two shiny stars separated by the Milkway through the rest of the year. This festival, Qixi Jie, "The Night of the Setes", is known to be an occasion to publicly emphasize the virtues and work of ladies, then usually confined to Gypeu. One night the poet noticed in a lone girl: «A silver candle shines in the fall before the cold painted panel, Holding a small range of gauze Silk light, pushes the moths away. Of the stairs arrives a breeze fresh like water, She sits down and contemplating And among the stars Discover Niulang and Zhinu. » The other women celebrating in groups were dedicated to various activities. In addition to the contemplation of the stars, they offered the gods, recited prayers, or dedicated themselves to weaving. All this in an environment of reverence and joy that can be observed, for example, in a horizontal roll of Ding Guanpeng (1708-1771), ladies on the night of the seven appealing to their talents (paper ink, 28.7 x 386.5 cm, at the Shanghai Museum). From the weavers there would be some, especially those of educated families who would be weaving maybe with human hair, a beloved figure of Buddhism, Bodhisattva Guanyin. In such a way the adepts felt close to the one who "contemplates the sounds" of those who direct them, postponing their release to help the enlightenment of others, who redo their figure as a form of asceticis. item.description: Ana Cristina Alves, auxiliary researcher and coordinator of the Educational Service of the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center May 20, 2025 Cultural Introduction and Comparison What is the implicit popular philosophy in Wu Cheng´en's West Pilgrimage (吴承恩) 1500 - 1582? This was written during the Ming Dynasty and published in 1570, about the time when the Lusíadas de Luís Vaz de Camões, the Camonian epic, would be edited in 1572. In the western pilgrimage, we are looking for an imaginary recreation of a group of pilgrims, headed by the monk of the Tang Xuanzang Dynasty (唐玄奘 Xuánzàng), to conquer a new spiritual world, that of Buddhist religion, to which the Chinese should adhere to a better ethical-moral conduct for a much-diverted population of good teachings and conduct. Those who lead the initiative to free the Chinese from suffering is, of course, the deity of compassion, Guanyin (观音 Guānyīn), always attentive to all distressed souls, ready to launch their help. Already in the case of Os Lusíadas, composed by Luís Vaz de Camões (1524/5-1580), a journey is also narrated, but it is real, inseparable from spiritual and religious aspects, because made in the name of the universality of the Christian faith, but being inseparable from the concrete journey, which implies the very human and Renaissance conquest of a better world for people, in which the Portuguese can not the Portuguese Just survive, but command and imperate, because they are worthy of an old history and very valuable warriors. Therefore, the heroism of the discoveries, living in the Christian faith, but accompanied and protected by the Renaissance Belling that recovers the classic spirit and deities, such as the protective Venus, a loving deity that sails for the Portuguese, and the aggressive and jealous Bacchus, the god of wine who wants to lose them. The west pilgrimage by the Chinese is performed in the name of collective liberation and salvation, through contact with Buddhist sutras; The Portuguese “pilgrimage” to the east is also in the name of a collectivity, saves souls and extends to the whole land, given the proselytist vocation of Christianity and globalizing merchants, as well as the navigators, Camões his poetic herald desires the spread of faith by a great empire built by Portuguese heroes, as read in the first resort of singing first: The weapons and the barons marked That of the western Lusitana beach, By seas never of before navigadas Also passed beyond TAPROBAN, In hardworking dangers and wars, More than promised human strength, And among remote people built New kingdom, which so sublimated; That would be translated into Chinese by Zhang Weimi 张维民 in 19981 as follows: 威武的船队 ， 强悍的勇士 ， 驶离卢济塔尼亚西部海岸 ， 越过自古茫无人迹的海崖 ， 甚至跨越塔普罗瓦那海角 ， 经历千难万险、无穷战争 ， 超出人力所能承受的极限 ， 在那荒僻遥远的异域之帮 ， 将灿烂辉煌的新帝国拓建。 张维民 (译) 《卢济塔尼亚人之歌 • 第一章 ， 一》 Both pilgrimages are true poetic adventure novels, the Lusíadas in poetry, the west pilgrimage in poetic prose and poetry. In the latter, Bodhisattva Guanyin will subdue 4 monsters who will be the companions of the monk Xuanzang. Bodhisattva takes an embroidered accent and a nine -lap ring to deliver to the monk. The latter, if effectively fulfilling his 14 -year mission, escapes the wheel of reincarnation (Jenner, 1994: 60), and his disciples, disobedient divine forces falling into the human world, will be able to return to heaven, where they will again occupy divine positions. Guanyin also delivers a band, which causes terrible headaches to the disobedient King Monkey (Jenner, 1994: 60). The monsters and indomitable spirits are presented. First Sun Wukong (孙悟空 Sūn Wǔkōng), by King's disobedient monkey transits the obedient guardian of the Buddhist religion. Guanyin will free this indomitable spirit, prisoner in the mountain of the five elements (五行山 wǔxing shān), as punishment for the disobediences they have no account. Then a heavenly marshal who will pass the pig. He is Marshal Tian Peng (天篷 Tiān Péng) of the Milky Way, tried to seduce the Divinity of the Moon, was punished by the emperor of Jade with axes and condemned to exile on earth. Bodhisattva baptized him with the nickname of Zhu Bajie (猪八戒 Zhū Bājiè), which means "Pig of the eight abstinences," and gave him the name Buddhist of Zhu Wuneng (猪悟能 Zhū Wǔnéng), ie "awakening pork for power" (1994: 63). There will be an ogre that will be dominated and transformed into a sand monk. Was punished for being a distracted heavenly general. He paid the distraction with 800 whipping, having been exiled to Earth, where he devours travelers hidden in the waters of the floating river. Guanyin frees him, baptizing him with the nickname "sand" (沙 shā), and the Buddhist name of Wujing (牾净 Wǔjìng), which means "awake to purity." Follows is the son of the West Sea Dragon King who will be metamorphosed on a white horse. He was denounced by his own father for burning the bright pearls of the palace. Jade emperor punished him, suspending him in the air. He gave him 300 whips, letting him wait for death. Prince Dragon is freed to turn into the white horse of the Xuánzàng monk, or as he is known in Chinese, on the white-dragon horse, (白龙马 白龙马 Lóng Mǎ). In the term of the pilgrimage, Zhu Wuneng spiritualized, ascends to heaven, being rewarded with the heavenly position of cleans. But there are more honors to the group of victorious pilgrims who led the Sutras to China: the sand monk will receive the title of Golden Holy (Arhat), the monkey will be named Buddha of the victorious fight and the Sanzang monk will receive the title of Buddha do Merit (Buddha Candana-Punya.) As well as the white horse will rise the heavenly dragon. Proverbial popular philosophy Among the pilgrims are, as is well known, the monkey and the pig that escorts the great monk and Buddhist translator Xuanzang [唐玄奘 Xuánzàng (c. 602-664) or Sanzang (三藏 Sānzàng), the monk of the three Buddhist treasures (Buddha himself, teachings or Dharma, the monastic order or Sangha), the monastic order), Mandated by Emperor Emperor Táng Tàzōng (唐太宗, R. 626-649) to go to the Holy Scriptures from India. These will be delivered by the historic Buddha that resides in the Pico do Vulture, because "there are many greedy and evil creatures in the east, which are bought to cause suffering to others, killing and fighting nonstop." (Jenner, 1994: 58). Therefore, Buddha wanted to distribute the Scriptures through the Chinese world. In popular and proverbial philosophy, which today rushes from mouth to mouth, it is drawn to the existential duel, between two of the five pilgrims, very similar to that of the work Don Quixote, by Miguel de Cervantes (1547-1616), composed between 1605 and 1615, in which the author puts in dialogue two opposing and complementary characters, Don Quixote and Sancho Pança: Romantic, dreamer and even utopian, almost only skin and bone, as it is like an incarnate spirit; The second, materialist, realistic, pragmatic, a very strong and plump "feet". Mutatis Mutandis Zhu Bajie, the eight abstinence pig, and Sun Wugong, the west -west -awake to emptiness, have many of the opposite and complementary characteristics we find in D. Quixote and Sancho Pança. To confirm it, be aware of some of the said proverbials associated with King Monkey: 1) The seventy -two transformations of the monkey king (七十二变 qī shí èr bàn) 2) endless mutations (千变万化 qiān biàn wàn huà) 3) great confusion in the heavenly palace (大闹天宮 大闹天宮 nao tiān gōng) 4) Infinite Magic Powers (神通广大 Shéntōng-Guǎnggdà) 5) Appears and mysteriously disappears (神出鬼没 Shénchū-guǐmò) He has an infinite spiritual ability, which allows him to accompany universal movement and be in permanent transformation. It has numerous magical powers, learned from the best of Taoist masters, which enables him to successfully interfere in both the heavenly and earthly order, which is why he will be punished and only subjugated by the Buddha himself, which, tame it reveals it belongs to a superior spiritual and religious order. After a five hundred -year -old punishment, inflicted by the Buddhism patriarch, will be able to join the group of pilgrims that will successfully introduce sutras and Buddhist teachings in China. Sun Wugong reveals to be a complex and multifaceted character, retaining and enhancing the best and worst of human nature in his portentous intelligence, challenging and disobedient. It has a lot of difficulty in dealing with Zhu Bajie, for the stupidity and lust of the partner, always ready to sloth out and surrender to exclusively carnal pleasures. Zhu Bajie embodies some of the typical defects of human nature that are well revealed in the popular proverbial philosophy, as can be seen by some of the said mentioned: 1) Zhū Bájiè fails and never assumes his responsibilities (豬八戒上陈 Zhū Bájiè Shàng Chén) 2) Zhu Bajie is adorned with flowers (豬八戒戴花 Zhū Bájiè dài huā). 3) Zhū Bájiè is the mirror (CZHū Bájiè Kàn Jìngzi) 4) Zhū Bájiè departed by plane (豬八戒坐飞机 Zhū Bájiè Zuò Fēijī). In the first proverb, there is the difficulty of the pig to assume guilt whenever it makes mistakes, and how to make mistakes is human, there are no accounts at the times when shaking responsibilities; Already in the second is denounced a very characteristic defect between the people, the vanity, that is, the constant need for ornaments, and not only from the physical point of view, because here not only counts the clothing but also the titles, positions and honors, in a total inability to strictly self -evaluate. In the third said, the physical and moral fealade, which attracts complaints from others, for the lack of composure and, finally, this expression is used when someone goes to the best, but in a worse way, that is, without dignity. Finally, here are some more generally meaningful proverbs, taken from the west pilgrimage, who draw attention to the general evils of the world through the adventures of pilgrims, since, except Sun Wugong, others are very easily fooled by all kinds of monsters, demons, seductive spirits, etc., having great difficulty unraveling hypocritical behaviors in which they stumble through Journey, where they find “many guys to which they cannot see their hearts” or, in other words, abundant hypocrisy, as said (虚情假意 xū qing jiǎ yì). Therefore, they are constantly involved in sarilhos or situations that “have no feet or head”, which is literally translated into Chinese by “unequal sizes” (七长八短 qīm tea bā duān). Now in a misleading world, pilgrims are those who with good intentions go with the greatest goal of saving China, so the group finds itself in the situation of “big ship, great storm”, or as it is said in Chinese, “great tree that attracts the wind” (树大招风 shūo fēng) in a world where when virtue grows a few centimeters, so wickedness increases several meters (， ， ， ， ， ， ， Give gāo yī chǐ, mó gāo yī zhàng). Despite all the warnings, coming from popular wisdom and Romanesque adventures, the west pilgrimage and the Lusíadas end with the success of its protagonists, as the Portuguese expand around the world, Buddhism is introduced in China and all the characters in the poetic soap opera give rise to a proverbial source pedagogical. item.title: PAULO MAIA AND CARMO
item.description: Du Mu (803-852), Chang'an's poet, who in his imperial employee career was sent in successive missions to distant posts of the capital, often showed his inconvenience in the face of repeated separations. In one of his most admired poems he looked at the old narrative told since the Han Dynasty, which explains a traditional festival celebrated on the seventh day of the seventh moon, where once a year the meeting of a couple, cowboy Niulang and weaver Zhinu, identified with two shiny stars separated by the Milkway through the rest of the year. This festival, Qixi Jie, "The Night of the Setes", is known to be an occasion to publicly emphasize the virtues and work of ladies, then usually confined to Gypeu. One night the poet noticed in a lone girl: «A silver candle shines in the fall before the cold painted panel, Holding a small range of gauze Silk light, pushes the moths away. Of the stairs arrives a breeze fresh like water, She sits down and contemplating And among the stars Discover Niulang and Zhinu. » The other women celebrating in groups were dedicated to various activities. In addition to the contemplation of the stars, they offered the gods, recited prayers, or dedicated themselves to weaving. All this in an environment of reverence and joy that can be observed, for example, in a horizontal roll of Ding Guanpeng (1708-1771), ladies on the night of the seven appealing to their talents (paper ink, 28.7 x 386.5 cm, at the Shanghai Museum). From the weavers there would be some, especially those of educated families who would be weaving maybe with human hair, a beloved figure of Buddhism, Bodhisattva Guanyin. In such a way the adepts felt close to the one who "contemplates the sounds" of those who direct them, postponing their release to help the enlightenment of others, who redo their figure as a form of asceticis. Fang Weyi (1585-1668) was a literate, poet and painter that was part of these literati who, with their artistic erudition, permeated Chan Buddhism. He was born in a family of high employees and married early in 1602 but in the same year he had been widowed and lost his daughter of this marriage. It is possible that these "heartbreaks of the heart" have deepened their Buddhist faith, lived in the reserve of the home environment. Figurated in a contrast between thick and undulating black traces to show off his wide white robes and the light detail with which he portrays his welcoming face. And the face as human, as much as the free gesture of the garments, reveals a strange transcendence.

item.title: Satellite Casinos | Government says that closing impact will be controlled
item.description:
It is official: the 11 satellite casinos will even end doors until December 31 this year, and Melco and the Macao Game Society have already announced the restructuring plans. Regarding the affected workers, the government presents numbers lower than those already mentioned by deputies and associations: 5,600. An impact on SMEs is still expected, but without a major consequence for banks
After much speculation, here is finally the authorities and operators have announced what will actually happen to the 11 satellite casinos operated in the territory. They all will close, and the Macau Game Society (SJM) Resorts and Melco have already defined the plans for what follows [see secondary text], which includes acquisitions of L'ARC and Bridge 16, as well as the transfer of workers and game machines. The executive presented yesterday, at a press conference, numbers of workers affected with the closing of the satellite casinos below those already referred to by sector associations. It will, after all, will be 5,600 and no more than ten thousand as some deputies said to these entities, and from this cake, 4,800 workers were directly hired by the operators of the game, so if the satellite casino, they can be integrated into their paintings. The rest, 800, were contracted directly by the satellite casinos themselves. There are still 400 non -resident workers (TNR) involved in this process. With regard to Mocha Clubs, 300 local workers and 50 TNR. Tai Kin IP, secretary for the economy and finance, said that "the data were collected by different means", but that the government calculations "are official". "As the other means came to this data, I don't know," he added. Asked about the support of these 800 workers, the Secretary for Administration and Justice, André Cheong, explained that "the owners of the satellite casinos have the responsibility to ensure the work relationship of these people." "In the case of the 4,800 hired by the dealers, such as Croupiers or Treasury Employees, they can return to work in these dealers' casinos. In relation to 800, the concessionaires have guaranteed the government that if they have employment problems they can absorb them and provide adequate jobs on the properties of the dealers," he said. Representative Song Pek Kei even talked about the possibility of about 15,000 unemployed, while Nick Law, in a plenary intervention, said that among the satellite casinos and associated stores, there were "13,500 workers", representing "4.6 percent of the total macao work force". POSSIBILITY OF CONVERSION Regarding small and medium-sized companies (SMEs) located in the neighborhoods that will no longer have these satellite casinos, namely in areas such as the Inner Port, Zape, Nape or Fishermen's Dock, the government predicts some impact but controlled. There are, in total, 320 stores that operate in the vicinity with 800 workers, and “about 400 workers will have another employment situation according to the reconversion of stores,” said Secretary Tai Kin IP. Essentially, and after the government's surveys, half of the 320 stores "will be affected directly by the satellite casinos closure, such as the pledge houses, mobile phones, restaurants and jewelery." However, Tai Kin IP pointed out that there will be others that will not have a great impact on depending on sales to residents. Above all, the ruler pointed out that this scenario may even constitute an opportunity. "It will be a challenge and an opportunity for the reconversion of stores. Traditional stores that have a close relationship with satellite casinos customers have to reconvert. Highlight that Hospitality Consultant Savills referred in March that the satellite casinos closure would devalue the hotels in 60 percent and cause more non-compliance with the SMEs, with bank credit obligations valued between 25 and 39 billion. Tai Kin IP devalued this scenario. “From the knowledge we have, the loans granted to satellite casinos involve less than 1 percent of all bank loan activity, and we find that the risks are very limited to the operation of banks. In terms of risk supervision indicators in the financial industry, such as capital flow and others, banks' behavior will be safe and stable.” Regarding the SMEs, Tai Kin IP said that the monetary and currency of Macao is “closely monitoring the situation with the banks to mitigate the recovery of customers”, and the secretary in advance that in April, “ten billion patacas were injected to loans to the SMEs, attenuating their pressures”. Asked about the timing of these measures, André Cheong said it is the right time. "It all depends on the dealerships' decisions and we now officially receive the decision. This is a problem that has to do with several casinos and a considerable number of workers, and we did not want that only at the end of the year they knew about their situation. With six months to finish the transition period we understand that this is the indicated phase to advertise," he said. No impact on recipes Given the budgetary revision for this year with 12 billion Patacas in the forecast of game revenues, André Cheong assured that the satellite casinos closure will not have a major impact on the overview of revenues. "We made the budgetary review with less 12 billion patacas due to lack of consumption. We believe that the closure of satellite casinos does not have great impact on the game's recipes," he said. The secretary also stressed that, as for the intention of SJM Resorts to purchase the enterprises Ponte 16 and L'ARC, the concessionaire "has to conclude this acquisition procedure until December 31, and if they cannot buy these satellite casinos [who operate in the projects] have to end."

item.title: Pecunaries Checks | Former Beneficiaries defend better assignment criteria
item.description:
Given the changes to the pecuniary reimbursement plan, HM has heard three permanent residents who will no longer receive the check because they do not reside permanently in Macao, including a macanese born in the territory. Arnaldo Gonçalves, academic and former Beneficiary, defends a better distribution of support depending on the income of families
The rules for the attribution of pecuniary checks will change and now it is really necessary to be 183 days a year in the territory. The exceptions are some and arrest with students from Macau who are attending courses abroad or residents to work remotely to Macau and who are enrolled in the Social Security Fund, among other situations. However, many people will be left out, even though they have lived for several decades in the territory or even macanese born in Macau, that is, many of the members of the Macanese diaspora. In the case of Arnaldo Gonçalves, a permanent resident resident in Lisbon, he lived several decades in Macau, having worked for the government and was a university professor in the area of ​​political science. Six years ago, he returned to Portugal, being renovated, and told HM that he was already waiting for the day he was going to stop receiving the ten thousand dates annually. "This measure aims to give people a counterpart, given the difficulties existing in consumption and the characteristics of life. I don't live in Macau, and I think from the point of view of equity, the government has never been able to make a fairer regime from the distributive point of view, because there is no system of attribution from the income, and deep down there are multimillionaires that gain the subseck, like the pensioners, all," he said. This is what Arnaldo Gonçalves says "lament". "It is hard work to make an assessment of people's economic possessions, and so everyone receives the same as it is more practical in administrative terms," ​​he said. Maria João Ferreira, macaense of gem, daughter of the famous poet Adé, will also fail to receive the pecuniary check. He says he understands, but also criticizes the executive's positions. "I was already waiting and accepted with all the tranquility. It is fair, since I do not live there and I have the chance to be 183 days. I thank the time of checks that was dismissed. I lived in Macau until I was 16, but I was born there and still have family. Even the pandemic was there every year of vacation. mentioned. Maria João Ferreira, currently in the direction of Macao's house in Lisbon, says she was “shocked” with a very concrete case. "A few years ago, when he was doing his doctorate, he learned of a civil servant who did two service committees in Macao and was a contemplated BIR money and even told me, not just me, that I thought it was funny as he was there so recently, he was entitled to such a benefit," he said. "This is what I think is bad. It is one thing to go to do a service committee in public administration, or two or three, but it was never, in fact, resident. It is, as it were, an immigrant, because it will only work. This is how I see things," he added. Patacas Amealdas For Arnaldo Gonçalves, the ten thousand annual patacas served as a “Management Fund” for trips to the territory, where he still has family and where he travels frequently. "I've never used this money for personal purposes, you know? But I think these changes are a good measure, justifiable, and I even think it's selfish, that I've been entitled to this support for so many years. There are other people who need it," he said. In the case of Maria João Ferreira, the cash of the pecuniary check was also used for expenses in Macao and with trips to the territory. "I have an account in Macao, and when I went there, if I needed to buy the plane ticket, my sister said the money here, or this money served to fund my stay in Macao," he explained. Sofia Mota, a permanent resident and former Maradora in Macao, regrets the absence of explanations for these changes. "It depends on what the pecuniary check is for, whether it is a way of distributing the wealth or profits of casinos to the people who are part of the territory, or have already done; either if it is a condition to be part of the territory. I do not realize the premise in which the pecuniary check measure is based, and depending on the premise these changes may be more or less acceptable." The teacher considers that "it makes no sense that those who contribute to social security at their own initiative, as is my case, are not covered." "It seems that there is a first and second and second social security system. People who come to Portugal to provide family care seem not to be covered and yet are out of the territory for reasons of force majeure. What is meant by providing subsistence to family members, is not realizing the function of the check and the coherence of exceptions," he said. Sofia Mota confesses that she also used money to "a management fund to go to Macau, or to invest in formation." The first reactions The changes to the pecuniary reimbursement program were presented at the end of May and report that three groups will be exempt from the obligation to be 183 days a year in Macao and thus receive the check. They are the residents under 22 in 2024 and where one parent meets the requirements for receiving the check; the beneficiaries of the disability pension and the beneficiaries of disability allowance. There are eight other situations where residents may have access to the check. This is what happens when residents attend higher education outside the territory; When they are hospitalized in a hospital outside the sons, those who are over 65 and live in the interior of China or, even under 65, have health reasons that justify the permanence inside China. Residents who work outside Macao are also covered by the exceptions to an employer registered at the MSAR Social Security Fund and residents outside the MSAR who are responsible for the family aggregate subsistence. These are also attached to the exercise of official functions outside Macao; the registration of domicile, work or study in the deepened cooperation zone; And yet the work done in the cities of large bay except Hong Kong that is left out. Deputy Pereira Coutinho manifested against the changes to the pecuniary check referring to violate the Macao Basic Law, namely in article 25, which guarantees the equality of the residents of Macao before the law and prohibits discrimination. The article determines that "the residents of Macao are equal before the law, without discrimination due to nationality, ancestry, race, gender, language, religion, political or ideological convictions, economic instruction and situation or social condition." More recently, the Macao Synergy Association publicly stated that changes to the pecuniary reimbursement plan in economic development are not in accordance with the wishes of the population. Ron Lam also criticized the executive for applying the changes “in a hurry” which only came to cause more controversy: “the government was in a hurry and applied a sudden measure, without making any public consultation, with only behind -the -scenes movements leading to the population to question governance,” he said. "Consultations with local associations were simulated, which only generated more criticism and caused more unnecessary controversy," he added.

item.title: Environment | Macau registers a new maximum temperatures in 2024
item.description:
The direction of environmental protection services yesterday launched new data on the environmental landscape in the territory, in the Macao Encounters of the Macao 2024. The data is not encouraging: last year a new record of maximum temperatures, more rain and typhoons were recorded. More electricity and water was spent, more garbage was produced and fewer recyclable waste was collected
Lame The Government of Macao, through the Directorate of Environmental Protection Services (DSPA) announced yesterday that 2024 reached a maximum temperature record in the territory, and there was also an increase in typhoons and precipitation. According to the Macau 2024 state report, the average temperature last year was 23.6 ° C, precisely the value that had been reached in 2019, the highest since the records began, in 1952. The average temperature of 2024 was 0.8 ° C higher than the average climacteric (average of 30 years, between 1991 and 2020), according to the document prepared by DSPA. In addition, Macau registered 42 days considered to be hot last year, more 10.7 days than the climacteric average, 29 hot nights, more 17.5 than the average, and 29 cold days, less 10.1 days than the average. Meteorological and geophysical services (SMG) classify as hot days when the maximum temperature is equal to or greater than 33ºC and the nights at which the minimum temperature is at least 28ºC. As for the days considered cold, they are those at which the minimum temperature does not exceed 12ºC. "With global warming, the occurrence of extreme weather phenomena is increasingly frequent," said DSPA in the report. In 2024, Macau was affected by seven tropical cyclones, known as tuffons, and for the first time three tropical cyclones affected Macao in November, the last month of the Typhoons, which begins in May. According to the report, the region last year received a total precipitation of 2,029.2 millimeters, "slightly higher than the climacteric average." DSPA also said that since 1970, sea level in Macao has risen at an average rate of about 3.5 millimeters per year. Also worldwide, 2024 was the hottest year that there are records and exceeded for the first time the 1.5 ° C above the pre-industrial level, in January the copernicus European service advanced in January. Last week, the world weather organization predicted that temperatures should continue to reach record values ​​by the end of the decade. More people, more expenses The DSPA report also tells that with the arrival of more tourists to Macau, there were also more waste and spending on water consumption, for example. "With the improvement of the economy, the number of visitors in 2024 increased 23.8 percent in annual terms for almost 35 million, having recovered about 90 percent of the pre-pound level. Tourist intensity also registered a certain increase, with GDP [Gross Domestic Product] climbed 8.8 percent. In addition, there was a slight increase in the population at the end of the year." Thus, it is added, "in relation to environmental indicators, economic and population growth led to the rise of estimated local emissions of greenhouse gases, invoiced water volume, electricity consumption and the amount of urban solid waste, compared to 2023". "During the pandemic, there was a decrease in the various economic and environmental indicators. However, with the constant improvement of the economy, most of these indicators rose again," is explained. With regard to the volume of invoiced water, in thousands of cubic meters, by 2023 the record was 89,164 and last year, 94.123, which constitutes an increase of 5.6 percent. Regarding electricity consumption, in millions of kW/h, in 2023 it was 5,740, while in 2024 consumption went to 6,030, plus 5.1 percent. The report also highlights the tons of urban solid waste produced, which in 2023 was 501,512, rising 5.1 percent last year to 526,979 tons. Another worrying fact of waste level was the fall, for the third consecutive year, the volume of recyclable waste collected, which went from 24.5 percent at 2021 to 21.7 percent last year. Changed for kids, of all recyclable waste generated in Macao, only about one fifth are collected for recycling. In the report, IP Kuong Lam, director of DSPA, indicates that last year, "with the ongoing economic recovery, there was greater pressure on various environmental indicators, while climate change became more severe." Despite the results, the official said that the objectives are "to encourage greater participation of the population in environmental initiatives and together to achieve the view of building a macao with low carbon emissions." A question of gases The report released yesterday by DSPA also accounts for the panorama of greenhouse gases (GHG) gases, and last year, a global increase of “about ten percent, including carbon dioxide (C02), which represented 90 percent”. It also highlights DSPA that “the estimated emissions of GHE from the various sources have registered upon the same period (2023), except for landfill residues, and the most significant increases were verified in estimated emissions from local electricity production and air transport”. In addition, it is stated that, in 2024, the main source of Emission of GHG and CO2 was land transport, followed by local electricity production, waste incineration, trade, domestic consumption and services. "The main sources of CH4 emissions [methane] were the waste deposited in landfills and the treatment of wastewater, while the latter was also the main source of N2O emission [nitrous oxide]," he stresses in the document. DSPA clarifies, regarding the tendency of GHG emissions, that "after reaching the peak in 2017, local Emissions of GHG showed a decreasing tendency, year after year, having reached its lower value during the pandemic." However, with the recovery of economic activities and the great movement of people, especially "in the last two years, the estimated emissions of these gases has gradually rise again." The air we breathe Also with regard to air quality data is not encouraging, because in 2024 “the number of days with the average quality of air classified as 'good' or 'moderate' recorded in the six Macao air quality monitoring stations reached 88 percent, slightly lower than 2023”. There was, in a total of the year, 15 to 34 days with “unhealthy” classification, and only two days obtained the classification of “very unhealthy”. According to DSPA, “the pollutants detected in the air monitoring stations were mainly ozone (O3) and thin particles suspended (PM2.5)”, while “at Berma da Estrada station (Ká-Hó), the highest index detected all year round, classified as 'very unhealthy', was the O3 the main pollutant”. Last year, July was the best air quality month, while October to December obtained the worst qualification according to data from Macao air monitoring stations. The report also reveals that “in terms of compliance with atmospheric pollutant concentrations in 2024, average annual PM10 and PM2.5 concentrations recorded in the various monitoring stations were lower than standard values”, while “the average annual nitrogen dioxide concentrations (NO2) also set below standard values, except for Road Berma measures (Macau) and at the High Density Areas station (Macau) ”. More optimistic data is also revealed “daily averages of sulfur dioxide concentrations (SO2) and the maximum averages of eight hours of carbon monoxide concentrations (CO) verified in the various stations throughout the year”, as “both were below standard values”. “In all seasons there was a record of the maximum averages of eight hours of O3 concentrations to exceed standard values ​​in some days. In relation to atmospheric pollutant concentrations recorded in the monitoring stations, generally the average annual concentrations of PM2.5 and NO2, while PM10 and CO descended”, and “as in the road station season (Macao) Only in 2024 did SO2 and O3 begin to be monitored, no comparisons were made. ”

item.title: June 10 | Alexandre Leitão highlights the end of the waiting lists at the Consulate
item.description:
Yesterday was held at the consular residence in Bela Vista, the usual celebration ceremony of June 10-Portugal, Camões and the Portuguese Communities. Alexandre Leitão, Consul, highlighted the end of the waiting lists in the consulate and the modernization of some services, noting that Portugal is ready to promote stronger economic ties with the MSAR
After years when renewing the citizen card or passport could be a small major problem for Portuguese citizens to reside in the MSAR, since this subject seems to be solved. Alexandre Leitão, Portuguese consul-general in Macao and Hong Kong, proved yesterday to be a satisfied man to talk about the last achievements achieved in the operation of the Portuguese Consulate-General in Macau and Hong Kong, this regards the June 10th, Portugal, Camões and Portuguese Communities celebrations. "After two years of intense concentration in the normalization of consular services, we eliminated waiting lists in the field of issuing citizen cards and passports," he said. According to Alexandre Leitão, "users have returned access to 90 percent of services without prior appointment, we introduced electronic payment, we drastically reduce response and referral times after the admission of processes, and reorganize human resources and procedures." The consul did not forget the consulate's team, "which is constituted, almost in full, by Macanese who have positively reacted to the successive challenges that have been presented to them", also noting that "in 15 months were emitted or renewed 55 thousand cards of citizen and passports, which also demonstrates the dimension of the Portuguese community of Macau and Hong Kong." Portugal with value Thus, the official said he could “safely say that the essential, from the strictly consular point of view, is done”, but intends to bet on the “deepening of Portugal's diplomatic, economic and cultural relations with the special administrative regions” of Macao and Hong Kong. Addressing the Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai, Alexandre Leitão recalled that the ruler “has defended the acceleration of the opening and diversification of the economy” and that from this point of view Portugal has a privileged role to fulfill. "Portugal has the same purpose, which makes us, once again, bridged in a common purpose: to grow and diversify our economies, internationalizing them for the benefit of our peoples. Portuguese companies are prepared to take advantage of the" most open and inclusive posture to intensify international ties and increase global projection and attractiveness and the renowned Macao as an international metropolis "," Since, they are aware of the contribution of Portuguese companies and workers to the growth and quality of Macao economy services ”. The consul was still clear in saying Sam Hou Fai that "he can count on the Portuguese community to actively participate in the ambitious design of economic diversification of Masters." Alexandre Leitão did not forget the last major Chinese investment in Portugal, namely in Sines, by Calb - China Aviation Lithium Battery, being “the largest of the decade”, which “demonstrates the confidence of large Chinese companies and the quality and capacity of Portugal as the preferential investment destination”. Camões, the Great Given that there are numerous celebrations of the 500th anniversary of the birth of Luís Vaz de Camões, Sam Hou Fai brought the Portuguese poet to his speech at yesterday's ceremony in Bela Vista. “The strong and deep historical ties between Portugal and Macau are already known to all, and are reflected on this day, because today is also celebrating the largest Portuguese poet who lived a few years in Macao and was part of the first moments of this historical meeting of two peoples.” "It is never too much to remember that it is because of this centenary meeting of cultures, in this" outdoor window "of China, that the" uniqueness "of Macao arises as" the only place in the world whose official languages ​​", as expressly underlined by President XI Jinping," said the chief executive. Sam Hou Fai has not yet forgotten the “commitment and commitment of the Government of MSA in the concentration of efforts to build a higher level opening platform”, as well as the “reinforcement of bilateral opening with Lusophony and promoting comprehensive mutual benefits cooperation that enriches and further widen the role and functions of Macao as a sino-illusion platform”. The chief executive's words also referred to the defense “Macao's multicultural characteristics” and promoting “development in all strands, seeking to continually ensure and improve the well-being of all residents of Macao, including Portuguese communities in Macao”.

item.title: Cooperation | A look at the approach to Spanish -speaking countries
item.description:
The MSAR was already approaching Spain, but the chief executive began to refer to official speeches the importance of cooperation between Macao and Spanish -speaking countries, as well as the usual Lusophone world. Analysts relate these words to the current panorama of relations between China and Spain
The chief executive, Sam Hou Fai, has expressed in some discourses the importance of having to establish economic and commercial relations not only with Portuguese -speaking countries, but also with Spanish -speaking ones. Last month, on a public occasion, the government leader stated that the territory has to "welcome foreign friends to invest in Macau and also to realize his dreams in Macao." Sam Hou Fai highlighted the area of ​​advanced technology, stressing that “they can come from Portuguese and Spanish-speaking countries” because “as long as they are in favor of economic diversification, they are always welcome,” he added. Moreover, after the inauguration of the new government, Tai Kin IP, secretary for the economy and finance, made, in March, a visit to several European countries, leading a delegation that passed through Spain, Portugal, Belgium and Monaco to deepen “international links and explore opportunities for cooperation”, according to official information released at the time. This approach to the Spanish -language universe, in addition to the usual connection already established between China and the Lusophone world, can have several origins: the growing relationship between China and Spain, as well as the desire to diversify the economy by MSAR, say analysts contacted by HM. “The interpretation of Sam Hou Fai Declaration is very objective and pragmatic and can be summed up to the Macao economy diversification project, for which companies and investors are not only in Macao, but also from Portuguese-speaking countries. But the fact is that companies and institutions in Portuguese-speaking countries are not being effective in response to this need for Macao. For cooperation it seems logical to me, ”said economist Maria Fernanda Ilhéu, former resident of Macao and president of the Friends Association of the New Seda Route (ARS). According to the leader, “Macau is a pure market economy, is classified by the World Trade Organization as a free port with its own international agreements both in the economic, commercial, investment, financial, health, sports, sports, international relations agreements with various organizations. Therefore, the business in Macau is very free, and the part of the government of Macau is to promote and frame this opening”. "As Sam Hou Fai says, all companies and investors who bring Macao economy diversification solutions are welcome," he added. To Cátia Miriam Costa, professor at ISCTE - University Institute of Lisbon, and specialist in Chinese foreign policy and Macao, considered the HM that “this connection to the Spanish stems from the high -level official visits made by the Spanish government to China, that is, there is certainly one of the consequences of the repeated presence of Spanish diplomacy on a very high level, reinforcing the ties between the two. countries ”. THE IMPORTANCE OF GLOBAL SOUTH It is true that Beijing, in the words of President XI Jinping, has shown great interest in the approach of the countries of the so -called “global south”, where Portuguese and Spanish speaks, essentially. For Cátia Miriam Costa, here also resides another explanation for the change of paradigm in the field of commercial and economic cooperation. "It seems to me that recent meetings with high Spanish political representatives have influenced this decision, along with China's increasing political investment in the global south where Portuguese and Spanish are, in fact, the most spoken languages." For Académica, "the strategy of using Macau as a convergence point may be historically justified by its cosmopolitanism, but also by its traditional role in including the routes that connected Asia to Latin America." In addition, "adds to a historical perspective, a contemporary view for a region that needs economic diversification and benefits from this proximity to distant spaces, whether historical or culturally." Cátia Miriam Costa understands, therefore, that "Spanish can be seen as an additional value to Portuguese, without distorting the paradiplomacy strategy defined for Macao early on." The inclusion of Equatorial Guinea in the Macao Forum cannot be ignored, as a result of its entry to the CPLP - community of Portuguese -speaking countries. However, Cátia Miriam Costa believes that this change has little or nothing to do with the inclusion of Spanish -speaking countries in the official commercial approach discourse. "The inclusion of Equatorial Guinea in the Macao Forum stems from another circumstance, that of his participation as a member of the CPLP. In this sense, it was a logical step to its integration into the dynamics of the Forum. However and although it can count as a positive element in this approach, the leverage that Equatorial Guinea has in the Hispanic or Hispanic speaking world," he pointed out. ASES BY ARE Maria Fernanda Ilhéu also highlighted the fact that the only direct air connection between Macao and Europe will be for Madrid and not to Lisbon. “By chance, TAP or the Portuguese government have contacted Air Macau or the Macao government expressing interest in resuming this airline? I don't know, but I know that this connection will greatly contribute to strengthening the Spanish presence in Macao, whether in tourism, commerce or investment.” The guardian highlights the complementarity factor of the air route. "Is the Portuguese and Spanish presence in Macau is incompatible? It doesn't look like, but it is competitive, it may even be beneficial if they know how to collaborate and gain scale in the Great Bay area, but Portugal has to strive more to their presence in Macau is not a historic relic." Moreover, the economist does not forget the role that Portuguese foreign policy may play in this issue, with the removal of Huawei in Portugal and a closer approach to Beijing in recent times. “Portugal's decision banning the use of Huawei equipment says mainly respect for the economic relations of Portugal with mainland China and it is framed by a fearful diplomatic relationship that the Portuguese government followed from 2019 to 2024, contrary to the Spanish diplomatic relationship. It should be noted that the Spanish Prime Minister visited China several times during this period and the Portuguese government alone was represented by the foreign business minister. At the Boao Forum in Hainan, with a brief pass for Beijing. ” Thus, Maria Fernanda Ilhéu understands that between 2019 and 2024 “the Portuguese government and the Portuguese civil society were very conditioned by the American narrative of cold war and the formation of two antagonistic blocks, not knowing how to keep the line followed by 2019 to proceed with a relationship with China supported by the friendship and confidence of nearly 500 years of cooperation in Macau”. The necessary work For the economist and president of ANSRs, it is necessary to take into account the investments and business movements made in recent times to perceive the position of Portugal and Spain in this domain. “The last major investment of a large Chinese company in Portugal was registered in 2020, and only now is this type of investment with Calb investment [SINE Battery producer] that is in the implementation and licensing phase. If we see the same type of investments in Spain from 2020 to 2024 we can record five major energy investments, by China Three Gorges and Huadian; Transport, Geely, Chery Auto and Envision Group; a major investment in agriculture by Yankuang Beijing Energy and also a major investment in the health sector by Worg Pharmaceuticals. ” For the official, “a lot of work will have to be done by the new Portuguese government to develop Portuguese economic cooperation with mainland China and MSAR, but it will also have to be accompanied by Portuguese business fabric”, he summarized.
