item.title: EU has to be “much more vocal” about Israel in Gaza
item.description: Former European doctor Elisa Ferreira demanded yesterday to the European Union to be “much more vocal” about the boundaries that Israel “is surpassing” in the war against Hamas, defending an articulated voice of the community bloc. "Europe, even because of all the defense of human rights, has to be much more vocal to saying to Israel that it cannot exceed the boundaries it is exceeding, and that current international agreements do not allow certain actions," Elisa Ferreira said in statements to Lusa after a conference at the Consulate General of Portugal in Macau. However, the academic noted that Member States have never attributed competencies to the European Union in defense that allow it, for example, to intervene with armament in cases of country invasions. "That said, many countries-Ireland, Spain-they moved a lot, and I think there is a joint and joint voice to prevent us with a sense of impotence in the face of deaths that are absolutely unacceptable in the 21st century," said the former Minister of the Environment (1995-1999) and territorial planning (1999-2002) in the governments of António Guterres. Elisa Ferreira stressed that there have already been “there were some expressions of this will” by Lisbon and expects “to keep up”. PEACE STEPS In late May, Slovenia, Spain, Ireland and Norway, who recognized the Palestinian state a year ago, appealed to all countries to do the same compared to Palestine and Israel, as it is a necessary step for peace in the region. "We remember that recognition is another step towards the implementation of the solution of both states and we appeal to the international community to take the necessary steps to make it a reality, among them, the individual recognition of Palestine and Israel by the countries that have not yet done it," reads a "joint statement." Israel's retaliation for Hamas' attack on October 7 caused more than 54,000 dead, the destruction of almost all Gaza strip infrastructures and the forced displacement of hundreds of thousands of people. Elisa Ferreira wants to look for new partners like China Former European doctor Elisa Ferreira defended Lusa yesterday that the European Union must rethink partnerships and look for new interlocutors, including Beijing, to keep “a great actor” on the international scenario. "If there is an opportunity in every crisis, as I think the Chinese say, there is also an opportunity in this US leadership crisis, because it has shown us that Europe has to know where it wants to go and not lose control over its own agenda, and, on the other hand, it has to diversify partners abroad," said the former Portuguese minister in Macao, after a conference at Consulate General. In the current context of instability, China “has to be a great partner,” said the academic. "China is a great power. I think it has always been latent, now it is completely affirmed, especially in future areas, in stories of new digital and environmental technologies." "For a long time, Europe wanted to be driving out of new clean energy, energy savings technologies, etc.; I think China, when it defines it, when it determines, when it is organized, accelerates with an unstoppable speed," he noticed. In Macao at an invitation from the Institute of European Studies, Elisa Ferreira inaugurated yesterday the “conversations in the Consulate” cycle, with the lecture “Portugal: from the successes of the democratic Portugal to the crossroads of the present”.

item.title: Public Management | Totality of companies evaluated with notes above B
item.description: The Directorate of Services of Supervision and Management of Public Assets (DSSGAP) has evaluated with positive note all MSar companies with public capitals. On a scale of 0 to 100 points, there were no evaluated with a note below 70 points. None of the companies got the maximum grade, but CAM-Macao International Airport Society and the Society for the Development of Macao Industrial Parks were evaluated with “A-”, which means a note between 80 and 84 points. Most companies evaluated obtained a score greater than 75 points, but less than 80, which means a B+scale. This was the case of Umacert Investigation and Engineering Tests, Macao Urban Renewal, Macao, Investment and Development Securities Settlement and Settlement Center, S.A., Macao Science Center, Macao Orchestra Society, Macau Slaughterhouse, Macao Metro Society and TDM - Macao Teledifusion. Finally, the companies with worst evaluation went to UmTec and the Macao World Trade Center, whose final grade was a “B”, which represents an assessment of at least 70 points and a maximum of 74 points. The evaluation of the results of exploitation and operation results from the obligation imposed by the legal regime of public capital companies to evaluate these companies annually. Evaluations take into account different criteria, according to the nature and objectives of the evaluated companies. "Among the indicators of the exploitation and operation performance assessment of the year 2024, the essential indicator for all companies was the management performance, paying attention to the rationality and regularity of establishing the governance structure, the completeness of the establishment of internal management regimes, the exploitation in accordance with the law, as well as the regularity of information dissemination," was indicated by DSSGAP.

item.title: Culture | Wu zhiliang wants background to ensure national security
item.description:
The president of the Macau Foundation considers that the government must have a mechanism to ensure national security and patriotism in culture. As such, Wu Zhiliang defends the creation of a fund to promote national narratives in literature and the arts in general and the establishment of legal balances between freedom of expression and national security
Macau Foundation's chairman of the Macau Foundation, Wu Zhiliang, understands that the territory is facing challenges that cannot be neglected and that even in culture should be lower in defense of state security and nationalism. In a speech given Monday in Beijing at the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, Wu Zhiliang defended the creation of a mechanism that ensures national security and the promotion of nationalism in culture and the arts. Thus, the leader of the Macau Foundation, who finances, among others, cultural projects, understands that it is necessary to create a special background to promote nationalist narratives in literature and the other arts. To ensure that there are no violations of the law and the rights of residents, Wu Zhiliang suggested a bet on regional cooperation to gather efforts between Macao, Hong Kong and China's law schools. The objectives of the partnership would create a system of legal interpretation, with analysis of typical cases to define standards of balance between freedom of expression and national security. The partnership could also be extended to other areas of education, for example, with the establishment of a platform for sharing education resources resource resource intended for national security in the Great Bay, with a view to promoting an immersive learning model. Muscular response The intervention in the cultural area is viewed by the president of the Macau Foundation as a way of responding to the challenges that the MSAR currently faces, indicated in Beijing, without specifically realized. The official highlighted the social environment and cultural bases of the population as elements that not only demonstrate the effectiveness of governance in Macao, but guarantee national security through the deep articulation of social structure and cultural values. To this end, Wu Zhiliang highlighted the fundamental role played by the principle “One country, two systems”, whose success also depends on Macao's unique social environment, as well as the solid cultural identity. In addition to the application of the political principle, the official highlighted the improvement of the well-being of the population, the education system and the role played by the associative fabric. Wu Zhiliang particularly highlighted patriotic associations, and their social service networks that cover the entire city, which promote activities related to national security. In this regard, the leader gave as an example the mobilization that the associations achieved, taking about three thousand people to participate in the sessions of public consultation, when changes to the law relating to the defense of state security in 2023.

item.title: Satellite Casinos | Davis Fong says fakes are due to the market
item.description: The academic Davis Fong considered that the closure of 11 satellite casinos is due to the operation of the market and the fact that the concessionaires and companies that exploit the satellite casinos did not agree on the exploration of casinos. The position of the academic, and former deputy appointed by the chief executive, was taken in statements to the newspaper or Mun. From the optics of Davis Fong, the end of these spaces was mainly due to the mismatch of the positions between operators and the game concessionaires, as with the changes to the game law, companies that explore the satellite casinos are no longer paid according to the revenues of the casinos, and can only be paid through the so-called replacement contract, ie a fixed monthly payment. The director of the Institute of Studies on the Game Industry of the University of Macao also devalued the impact of the closure of these casinos on the local economy, indicating that a period of transition to the satellite casinos is currently taking place, and that in the last two and a half years the possibility of closure was known. For this reason, Davis Fong indicated, many restaurants have moved Zape's location to Nape to prepare for the new scenario without these casinos. Although he was known as a game specialist, Davis Fong did not hinder that even without casinos Zape remains an area with commercial value, and that traders in that area should think of new way of attracting other customers. Fong left as suggestion the development of night trade. The former deputy also opined that employees of the satellite casinos linked to non-game areas will face difficulties in obtaining a new job, so they argued that concessionaires should find employment alternatives for future unemployed.

item.title: Portugal | Luís Montenegro visits Macau and China in September
item.description:

The president of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, returned a return to Macau on Monday, but announced that Prime Minister Luís Montenegro is expected to go through the MSar in September during a visit to China. item.title: Cabrita defends in Beijing Maintenance of Macao in a space of fundamental rights
item.description: Former Portuguese minister Eduardo Cabrita defended yesterday in Beijing, that Macau must remain a space for respect for fundamental rights, highlighting the importance of autonomy and the legal system of the region, of Portuguese matrix. "It is essential, first of all, to the population of Macao," Cabrita told Lusa agency, on the sidelines of a Symposium on the 5th anniversary of the Hong Kong National Security Law, organized by the China Academy of Social Sciences, a reflection group ('Think Tank') under the protection of the Chinese (executive) Council. During the intervention, the former governor highlighted several articles of the Macao Basic Law, including those that guarantee legal equality, civil liberties and protection against arbitrary arrests or inhuman treatments. In 2020, following protests that originated violent confrontations between protesters and security forces in Hong Kong, Beijing imposed a national security law in the former British colony. Last year, the Hong Kong Legislative Council approved new legislation that complements this legal framework. No comments Eduardo Cabrita, who worked in Macau between 1989 and 1996, refused to comment on the situation in the former British colony. "The essential thing is to ensure that what are the fundamental principles of autonomy and Macau as a space for respect for fundamental rights are assured," said the former minister, on the sidelines of the Symposium, which was attended by former Hong Kong Secretary of Justice Teresa Cheng Yeuk-Wah and Macau Foundation President Wu Zhiling. Recalling that he has not “experientially” to follow the current reality of Macao, Cabrita praised the work that “aimed to ensure the maintenance of a legal system based on respect for fundamental rights and a system of law originated in a Portuguese matrix, with principles as unique as the prohibition of death penalty or respect for fundamental rights”, which differentiate the special administrative region of the Chinese continent. "This is the willingness of those who had responsibilities in the transition process, who worked for this future, who want to continue to follow and to want to be guaranteed," he said. The Basic Law, created on March 31, 1993, rules Macao since the transfer of Portugal's administration to China in 1999, under the principle of “one country, two systems”, which would allow the coexistence of capitalist societies in Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan in the Chinese communist regime. The 'miniconstitution' translates stipulations of the Luso-Chinese joint declaration on the issue of Macao, signed by Portugal and China in 1987, deposited in the United Nations as an international agreement, in which Macau is allowed to “exercise a high degree of autonomy and enjoy Independent Executive, Legislative and Judicial Powers”, as well as maintaining “unchanged for 50 years and the way of living before existing ”.

item.title: Natural Gas | Announced price descent between 4.49% and 8.13%
item.description:
The reduction in the cost of natural gas has been justified with the descent of international price in recent years and with Renminbi exchange rate fluctuations
Since yesterday the price of natural gas has been lower, with reductions ranging from 4.49 percent and 8.13 percent. The information was released yesterday morning in a statement by the Directorate of Environmental Protection Services (DSPA), which means that the price will be reduced for the second time in two years. "In response to the descent of the international natural gas price in recent years and the fluctuations of the Renminbi exchange rate in relation to Pataca, the cost of acquiring natural gas to supply Macau has lowered. For this reason, the Government of MGI has adjusted […] the prices of sales of natural gas," he was reported. "Natural gas sales prices practicing for the four groups of customers had descents of about 4.49 percent to 8.13 percent," he was added. In terms of the changes, the largest reduction aims at Group D of clients, also called “special”, which will benefit from a reduction of 8.13 percent, to 3.9825 patacas per cubic meter. Until yesterday, the price was 4,3348 patacas per cubic meter. The second group with the largest discount is Group A of operators, with a cut in the price of 7.39 percent, from 7,3190 patacas per cubic meter to 6,7792 patacas per cubic meter. Regarding group B of non -commercial residents, the cut is 4.68 percent, to 6,4164 patacas per cubic meter, when previously the price was 6,7314 patacas per cubic meter. Finally, in group C, of ​​the large customers, there is a 4.51 percent cut to 6.3568 patacas per cubic meter, from 6.6556 patacas per cubic meter. Price Changes This is the second consecutive year with cuts in the price of gas supply. In early 2024, then -head of the executive, Ho Iat Seng, announced a price reduction of 3.4 to 5.6 percent. "In recent years, the market price of natural gas registered at the international level has also maintained at a high level. However, due to Renminbi exchange rate variations in relation to Pataca, the cost of acquiring natural gas to supply Macau has lowered," was justified in January 2024, also in a DSPA statement. "For this reason, the Government of MSA has adjusted […] the sales prices of natural gas […], entering the new prices in force starting today [yesterday]. Natural gas sales prices to practice for the four groups of customers had descents of about 3.4 percent to 5.6 percent," was added.

item.title: In the month of sexual diversity, who do we preach?
item.description: My intuition tells me that we are on the wrong way. We are entering a complex dark tunnel system, in a labyrinthine mountain, with little possibility to see light points. These warmths are still far from our reach - not before we cross the darkness and the winding curves that the rock naturally forms. In the game between light and shadows, we lose ourselves in dichotomies that deluded us, judging us on the way to progress, unity, diversity and respect. Given what is happening in the world, socially and politically, empty theories arise - theories of those who think it understands the complex development system that is ours: the human. We are fish in the ocean trying to make sense of water, without ever having a state outside it. June is the month of LGBTQIA+celebration, and the tension is palpable. Pinkwashing, i.e., marketing that takes advantage of social causes and civic for profit-proves to be fragile. The colors of the rainbow are no longer seen as seen last year or two years ago. Now defending the LGBTQIA+ cause can cause damage. In addition, social networks are filled with complaints, as if the celebration of homosexual pride required an opposite celebration of "heterosexual pride." As if being heterosexual were not already celebrated around the corner of the world, with full rights in love and union. What we see, instead, is a misunderstanding that only feeds more hatred, more prejudice - and in many cases more death. We live in a schizophrenic world: on the one hand, illusion; on the other, the disguised rot. Both sides suffer from the same evils. Develop spaces to talk about sexuality-so that people better understand themselves and others-it seemed to me a natural mechanism for the normalization of the subject. However, the confusing and hateful information paths overpassed. How does Elon Musk's absurd theory come about? What empathy destroys civilizations? And love - also destroys them? Is this natural act that leads to sex and procreation is not based on this intimate and simple relationship of empathy? We are lost. Resting in the trenches of the battle of ideas, there is still hope - hope that certain ideas do not have to be defeated by others. In Thailand, in January this year, same-sex marriage was legalized. In Hong Kong, news agencies celebrate homosexual unions - impossible in China, Macao or Hong Kong - that find in other Southeast Asian countries the possibility of acceptance. I have reflected a lot on how to reach those who need to review in a friendly word, and to understand that the freedom to be is a human right. There are many lives at this time, whose value is minimized - as if one life was worth less than another. In the month of sexual and gender diversity, where the sense of the right to existence reigns, I want to honor the decreasing people, who are erased, raped and killed for the worst reasons. From Palestine to the rest of the world. I don't know if I'm preaching to fish, converts, or simply to anyone. But if these words come to the eyes of those who need it, I am satisfied. There are no revolutionary fantasies here - just the belief that one must be on the side of understanding and empathy. The mechanism that has allowed the progress of societies to this day.

item.title: Michael Hui (i)
item.description: After the film star Tony Leung Chiu-Wai (梁朝偉) received two doctors Honoris causes last year, another artist was awarded the same distinction this year. This time, the honor was up to Michael Hui Koon-Man (許冠文), known as “Poker-Faced comedian” (冷面笑匠). Michael Hui Koon-Man was born in Guangdong Province (廣東省) in 1942 with 82 years old. In 1977, he began working for the Hong Kong Television Broadcasts Limited (TVB) featuring the program “Hui Brothers Show” (雙星報喜) in partnership with his brother, the famous singer Sam Hui (許冠傑). Subsequently, Michael was discovered by director Li Han-Hsiang (李翰祥) who invited him to play the protagonist of the movie “The Warlord” (大軍閥), thus joining the film industry. Between 1974 and 1981, Michael wrote, directed and acted in five films: “Gamblers Play” (鬼馬雙星), “The Last Message” (天才與白痴), “The Private Eyes” (半斤八兩), “The Contract” (賣身契) and “The Security Unlimited” (摩登保鏢), all huge box office successes at the time. These deeds checked Michael a relief position in the film industry. Subsequently, Michael continued to win prizes. In 2022, he received the career award at the 40th edition of Hong Kong's film awards. In 2023, he received the best secondary actor award at the 41st edition of that event. Later, in 2024, he was handed over the Hong Kong Director Union award. Recently, the movie “The Last Dance” (破地獄) obtained a revenue of over $ 100 million, returning to catapult it to the pinches of fame and fortune. Michael received many awards, which means that it deserves to be distinguished with a doctorate Honoris Causa. Why did you get so successful in the film industry? Let's look for the answer in your work. Michael Hui Koon-Man has been a cinema and television star since 1977, that is, about 50 years ago. When a person dedicates 50 years of his life to a career, he demonstrates dedication, enthusiasm and recognition for the profession. Enthusiasm can not only exist in the present, it must also project in the future. Michael says that if he had a second life, he would want to pass it on in movie studios. In the speech given by Tony Leung Chiu-Wai when he won a prize last year, let us remember that he said he fully believes that enthusiasm is an important factor for success. In the age that preceded the mobile phones, Michael always had a pen and notebook, in which he took a note of all the anecdotal situations he witnessed and then became part of the material he used in the movies. When he said the notes, he decided what situations would make the public laugh and those they would not do. The amazing fact is that Michael is not laughed. Therefore, there was the nickname of “Poker-Faced comedian” (comedian of the wooden face). His films also reflected the attention that gave the evolution of society. He knew the difference between the mentalities of the oldest and most recent generation and used this knowledge to provide joy to audiences. In the “talk show 2005” we found some dialogues about love like these I transcribe: “In the past, all love songs were like this: “Our hearts are linked to each other, even separated by thousands of kilometers, our love never changes” (心兩牽, 萬里阻隔相思愛莫變), “I think of you every night and I call your name kindly” (夜夜念奴嬌, 輕輕把名叫), But today, in romantic songs it seems to lack love: “Looking back, I was never happy with you” (回頭望, 伴你走, 從來未曾幸福過), "Being a cat, being a dog, not being a lover, being a pet can be charming." (做隻貓, 做隻狗, 不做情人, 做隻寵物可會迷人) These right observations brought Michael a multitude of applause. The applause of the public demonstrates the recognition of society through the points of view and the analysis of Michael Hui Koon-Man. Next week, we will continue to analyze the factors that determined the success of their films. item.title: Young people and explored nominations
item.description: Politicians, associations, political parties are not tired of talking about the housing problem. Hollow words that do not contribute to Portugal the serious problem of housing, especially the social, has a light at the bottom of the tunnel. Portugal is the country in Europe where the price of houses has increased. It is very motionless, but they are luxury condominiums, with access to rich only. The housing intended for affordable incomes is always focused on calendar. And who suffers more from this decision -making inertia of the rulers are the poor and the young. These are still 40 years old living at their parents' home. Young people have no possibility of renting a house in Lisbon or Porto. Its secondary course ends and when they decide to go to a university in Lisbon it is absolutely impossible for them to lease a house and student homes are minimal and expensive. Do you know what happens in Lisbon? Young college students are exploited in an infamous way. In the Capital Lisbon there are hundreds of owners of old houses that were built with six and seven bedrooms. Therefore, it turns out that these landlords rent the six or seven rooms to students for 500 and 600 euro a month and in the house there are only two bathrooms for all. Even worse is that explorers do not even pass receipts and escape the tax authorities regarding the approximate income of 4200 euros per month, if it is a six -room residence. Exploration and deplorable opportunism is fundamentally due to the lack of affordable housing, with the aggravation of being the parents of students paying the use of these rooms. Where is institutional inspection? Of course we do not believe that it will not be possible to find out where these homes that explore the students exist. Only on a Lisbon avenue we were aware that there are more than 20 homes with students rented to students. This is a situation that the new government could consider creating a group, like ASAE, dedicated exclusively to the irregularities committed and the exploration of young people who need a bed and a table to be students in college. The housing problem is also the decrease in birth rates. Obviously young people are unable to unite, contract family and live to think that the future is a problem. If they stay in their parents' homes, how can they acquire or lease a house to live with their mate and children who may be born? Impossible. We wrote with knowledge of the cause because we kept a chat with a young student from the Faculty of Letters who told us that he lives in a room of a residence with six more habitatures, all rented by 600 euros. And he stressed that the landlord reported that if he intended receipt Pecúlio to pay would have to be 750 euros. Deplorable. Another serious problem that is registered in cities such as Lisbon, Porto, Coimbra, Braga and Évora, among others, is the situation of women who are hired by employment agencies in order to be elderly people with reduced mobility or various types of dementia. These women, namely Portuguese, Brazilian and African, receive a salary when they receive less than half of what the contractor pays to these employment agencies. It is usually the children of these seniors and patients who pay, for example, 3000 euros per month and AMA workers receive the equivalent of the minimum wage. Many of them work on Saturdays and Sundays without being paid to double as the law requires. Sometimes they are women who live with family difficulties who have a job but will work on the weekend to raise some more money that helps in their survival. AMAs who have annual contract to work from Monday to Friday do not have any payment of Christmas allowance. Once again, we do not believe that the government is not aware of this reality and seeks to end with this kind of shameful exploitation. We all know how difficult it is to deal with day and night an elderly with dementia or that needs a wheelchair to move. These nominations still do extra jobs in the houses where they work, such as cooking, washing clothes and ironing, without any more remuneration. There are still cases where the elderly have pets and there are the exploited nominations that have to treat the animals and take them to the street. This type of exploitation, in our understanding, is just a new kind of slavery. This is what it is, with the rulers to whistle aside. Two relevant cases that would be deserving of a radical change so that the “Chicos-Parts” did not think that the world is those who exploit and enslave their fellow man.

item.title: The meteorological systems of early alert and their importance
item.description: (Continuation of the June 5th edition) Despite having an efficient meteorological service (administration of atmospheric, geophysical and astronomical services of the Philippines - Pagasa1) the Philippines, due to Haiyan, were the scene of one of the great tragedies related to tropical cyclones. In the case of Haiyan, the warning newsletters were issued, regularly and attentively, before and during the typhoon, but the fact that the flood risk maps were outdated made many people perished for taking refuge in shelters in areas considered safe in these maps. On the other hand, because there are many languages ​​in the country (over 180 languages ​​and regional dialects), bulletins are mainly issued in English and tagal, the two official languages. Thus, the reasons for such a large number of victims, besides the exceptional violence of the typhoon and flood risk maps were outdated, was the fact that the terms “Storm”, likely to be understood by much of the less educated population, were used. Among the recommendations expressed in the reports of the various missions in charge of evaluating the consequences of the typhoon excelled the need to urgently update the flood risk maps and the use in warning bulletins, less technical language in order to be easily understood by the populations. The Philippines, and some international media, reported that the president of the Guiuan2 municipality, the first Filipine city that was on the forecast of the typhoon, sent messengers with altifalantes, in motorcycles, to the various “Barangays” 3 of the municipality near the coast, warning the approach of a tsunami. The term "tsunami", although not technically correct in this situation, warned the populations, poorly sensitized by the forecast of a storm tide, to follow the instructions of the Civil Protection Authority in order to be evacuated, which was successfully achieved. It should be noted that people were well aware of the consequences of tsunamis, as news about the consequences of such a phenomenon that had occurred a few years earlier, in 2004, on the west of Sumatra, causing approximately 230,000 deadly victims in 14 different countries. The WMO and the United Nations Office to reduce the risk of disasters (UNDRR) 5 have insisted on the need to enlarge this type of early alert systems to other phenomena, in addition to those related to meteorology. Thus, the concept of early warning systems of multiple risks (internationally known as “Multihard Early Warning Systems”-Mhews), which cover various types of risks, considering interrelationships between them. The main risks that may be a reason for issuing multirriscos are essentially flooding, extractic cyclones, tropical cyclones (cyclones, typhoons, hurricanes), storm tides, droughts, forest fires, heat waves, landslides, seismos and tsunamis. According to the report “Global Status of Multi-Hazard Early Warning Systems 2024”, prepared by OMM and UNDRR (presented at COP29 by the United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres), countries with less developed systems have a mortality rate related to natural disasters of nearly six times higher than countries in which multirristers are most Advanced, and almost four times more people affected by catastrophes. It is expected that in the next conference on the climate, to be held under the auspices of UNFCCC6 (COP30-November 15-21, 2025, in Belém, Brazil), measures to improve early alert systems in countries where they are not properly implemented. References: Pagasa - Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration. Guiuan - Important city in the history of the Philippines. It is reported that, in the 16th century, it was on the Homonhon Island, belonging to that municipality, that Fernão de Magalhães landed for the first time in that archipelago. Perhaps for this reason the population of the city is mostly Catholic. Barangay - Administrative division in the Philippines, corresponding to the village. “Escap/Wmo Typhoon Committee” - has been headquartered by the Secretariat in Macao since 2007. UNDRR - United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction. UNFCCC - United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change.

item.title: Arraial de S. João | Macao Tower at a party on the 21st and 22nd
item.description: The village of s João is back, but still does not take place in the neighborhood of São Lázaro as it was usual for a few years. The party is scheduled for the Macao Tower multipurpose space, on the 21st and 22nd of this month, from 14:30 to 22h. According to a note from the organization, like what happened last year, there will be “handicraft tents, snacks and games, with a lot of music provided by local bands”. The camp is from the initiative of the Macanese Association (ADM) with the Macau Foundation allowance, with the logistical support of the Tower of Macau, the collaboration of other associations such as the Association of Macanese Youth (AJM), the Macaenses Instruction Promoter Association (APIM), the Casa de Portugal in Macau (CPM), the International Institute of Macao (IIM). The camp, more than a party in honor of a popular saint, corresponds to a community effort to maintain the tradition of celebrating the historical date of June 24, 1622, in which, by blessing from St. John, the population of Macao resisted and defeated the Dutch expeditionary force, preserving Macao with its own characteristics. This date was marked for centuries, such as Macao City Day. According to the same note, the realization of the Arraial "is fundamental and justification for recognizing its place in the intangible cultural heritage of MSAR."

item.title: FRC | Lúcia Lemos today presents the exhibition “metamorphoses”
item.description:
As an integral part of the June 10th celebrations poster - Portugal, Camões and the Portuguese Communities, the Rui Cunha Foundation hosts, from today, the show “Metamorphoses”, by Lúcia Lemos. The show makes a retropective work of the photographer, artist and former director of Creative Macau
The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) today presents, from 18h, the exhibition “Metamorphoses”, by Lúcia Lemos, which makes a retrospective of its artistic path, with works and compositions of different genres. The event is inserted in the program of the festivities of “June, Portugal's month at MSAR”. “Metamorphoses” brings together 44 pieces that link diverse artistic expressions and aesthetics, such as engraving, photography, installation, painting and ceramics. Lucia Lemos uses organic materials to body ideas, and meanings to her art, in the different languages ​​and forms she has been experiencing and learning throughout life, now with greater freedom and time to explore. The show emerges from “lived transformations and personal visual observations of the physical space - Macau - where I allowed myself to contaminate, never fail to practice portugality, as a sense of belonging from the place from which I departed four decades ago”, reflects the artist, cited in a FRC note. Lúcia Lemos recently retired from the Creative Macau project that founded in August 2003. A kind of symbiosis According to Lúcia Lemos, the retrospective that now exposes to the public also means the symbiosis of construction and maturation of its “identity, modeled by the changes in adaptation and adoption to the metamorphosis of the new place”. "Art and the artistic process are seeking forms of integration and connection of the human being into the nature and the world around him," he added. Lúcia Lemos built a professional career that crossed various arts and aesthetics, having started by obtaining an arts management diploma in 2001. Subsequently, he installed the Creative Macau Center for Creative Industries, which coordinated for over 20 years, and launched the Macao International Short Festival. Participated in more than 50 collective exhibitions in Macau and other places, with some award -winning works and varied artistic languages. Since 2002, he has individually displayed black and white photography in Berkeley, Curitiba, Lisbon, Macau, Monza, Palermo, Porto, Salzburg and Shanghai. The show will be evident until June 21st.

item.title: MONTH OF PORTUGAL | Bruno Pernadas acts this Friday at Red House

He has already taken over an interview that does not consider himself a singer, something that has to do with the cross -sectional form as he faces the music. "This has to do with how I hear music since childhood, which is a little different from most people I have known. I can't and make myself confusion to associate musical styles and genres. As I hear music from all genres, for me it is as if there was no genre, because the genre is being music, one language," he explained. Asked about the difference between what is recorded and played live, Bruno Pernadas explains that he always seeks to establish “a relationship”, because he makes “very different music, also within classical music, and also with film and dance music”. In this field, the soundtrack of “Patrick”, a film by Gonçalo Waddington. As a producer, he worked with Margarida Campelo in “Supermarket Joy”, released in 2023. But in his own name he started 11 years ago: in 2014 he launched “How Can We Be Joyful in A World Full of Knowledge”, followed by “Worst Summer Ever” released in 2016 and, in the same year, “Thos Who Throw Objects at the Crocodiles Will Be Asked to Retrieve Them ”, which completed the trilogy. More recently, in 2021, Bruno Penadas launched "Private Reasons". Today he looks back “positively”, explaining that last year he joined the team to celebrate the 10th anniversary of the first album release in his own name, with a tour. "How Can We Be Joyful in A World Full of Knowledge" took a year and a half to record and, according to Bruno Penadas, gave him a language that he only realized "when the album was finished." "During the process I didn't know very well how it was going to be the end result. I knew, more or less, where I had to go to get there, but I didn't really know how it was going to be. Then I knew it was going to make another album to continue this language that had invented, because it is a mixture of several languages, but it is not forced. Bruno Pernadas assumes that when he played last year songs from the first three albums he made in his own name, he found that there were songs that no longer made sense of him. "When I had to do the exercise of reproducing live, there were many things that I no longer identified. Some songs, from start to finish. They had melodic components closer to pop or folk music that no longer tell me much, and then made sense," he said. The musician even says that the album released in 2021, in the middle of pandemic, “Private Reasons” is the work that today tells you less. "It's very pop. With this that I don't identify at all, and it's much more recent than the first. There are strange things that happen." Bruno Pernadas even says that there would be songs of “Private Reasons” that would not even record today, namely track 4, “Theme Vision”, which was even entitled to music video. “I can be sure I would never release 'Theme Vision',” he said. Studio and Stage Bruno Pernadas takes over: "I don't even like to be in the studio." "In fact, I really like the creative process and when you can find the result. During my life I avoided going to studios, and I only go when it is really accurate. Only the idea of ​​those producers and composers, who are more producers, who are in a studio without windows for half his life, for me it is not unthinkable. I was unable to work in a place with the daylight," he said. There is, however, one thing that Bruno Pernadas likes a lot: of cinema, establishing a deep connection with the music he makes. “I think of discs like movies, but it's not like music for a movie. It's really like movies, when I think of a group of people who are going to participate in the album. When I'm writing part of a song I already know it's that person who will record and play, and I'm already writing for her, just as some directors write to a particular actor.” “Since I am a child I go to the movies, and I know that there are directors who usually think they perceive more of cinema than everyone else, but this is a mistake, because in my case, I don't think you realize more music about other people. Of course, according to a technical language, I keep this knowledge,” he said. Before acting in Macao, Bruno Pernadas passes the city of Shenzhen on Thursday, followed by shows in Zhuhai and Hong Kong, the latter on Sunday. Regarding the neighboring region the musician says he has “a lot of curiosity”, even for the cinema, especially the work of director Wong Kar Wai. “I've always seen more movies in Cantonese. Cinema made in China, I only know the great classics,” he said. The work of Bruno Pernadas is known in Japan, and in this tour the Portuguese musician also is present in the country. "What happened is that my records started going out in some magazines in Japan and, after a short time, the largest distributor in the country wanted to start distributing my records. And so began this story that is over. Then I proposed to make a concert. I've been twice in Japan, but this time I will play at Expo Osaka 2025," he concluded.

item.title: Creative Macau | New Miguel Quental exhibition with images of Goa
item.description:
After the first photography exhibition at the University of Macau, Miguel Quental again shows images of his own, but this time about Goa. The show is welcomed from Saturday at Creative Macau and intends to show the public the “rich inheritance of vibrant color” of a territory that once was the “capital of an empire”
Creative Macau hosts, from Saturday, a new exhibition by Miguel Quental, better known for his work in law, but this time presents his images taken in Goa. “Colors of Goa” is the name of the exhibition that opens from 6.30 pm on Saturday, presenting images of what was “capital of an empire”, from which “a rich inheritance of vibrant colors, aromas, flavors, images and beliefs that transcend our imagination”, describes the author of the photos, quoted by a Creative Macau statement. “In search of this legacy, I left for Goa, but the experience went far beyond what I could expect. Its ancient churches and other places of worship exhibit a captivating beauty, offering a unique and transcendent peace that goes beyond the spirituality to which they are dedicated. The manorial houses, full of history, details and emotion, resemble noble, majestic and impassible, full of art and memories.” It also describes. Miguel Quental does not forget either “the alleys of Velha Goa, Pangim, Margão and the Fontaínhas neighborhood, which breathe and offer us a vibrant and almost magnetic heritage that touches the soul and invites us to go beyond the historical and cultural memories that memory does not allow us to forget”. "In this spirit, I share some of the many images I took there, but I'm aware that much more to find out," says the author, who hopes that she will "invite her to visit her soon." I like the image Residing in Macao since 2002, Miguel Quental has been in the third individual exhibition. The last one was at the University of Macao in November last year, being a photographic project that was born from an exchange trip from the Center for Legal and Judicial Studies of the University of Macao to Angola and Mozambique. In addition to participating in the visit as a teacher, Miguel Quental photographed the daily lives of the populations of these countries. "As I like to do photography I was taking some images during these trips. This is a center that is dedicated to the comparative study of law and the publications that are made in Portuguese in its relationship with China, and I thought it was interesting to make known the culture and way of living from Angola and Mozambique to college students who never had access to this reality," he explained to HM at the time.

item.title: Analysis | Closet casinos closure with more complex impact for SJM
item.description: The announcement of the closing of 11 satellite casinos until the end of this year was received by analysts and expert of the sector as a "negative surprise." In a succession of notes released yesterday, in a reaction to Monday's announcement, several analysts highlighted the greatest complexity for the transition SJM to a period without satellite casinos, given the expected transient softness to Melco and Galaxy concessionaires. It is recalled that of the 11 gaming spaces that will end, nine operated on the SJM license, leaving only the Casinos of Ponte 16 and L'Arc Macau. For now, it is not yet known whether the dealership will acquire all the property or just the space spaces, but whatever the decision will require government approval. In a note released yesterday, JP Morgan Securities indicates that the impact of closing the operations of the satellite casinos operating with Melco and Galaxy will be “insignificant” to dealers, as their results represent minimal percentages in the operations of both groups. The SJM is in a completely different situation. Although satellite casinos operations only represent about 4 percent of profits before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (EBITDA), “controllable” volume, the realignment of about 440 satellite casinos game tables will add thousands of workers to the company's salary sheets. If SJM does not significantly add its market share thanks to the new game tables, the flow of workers may result in losses for the company, JP Morgan analysts indicate. On the other hand, the CSSA highlighted the surprise of the end of operations of some satellite casinos that had been presenting profits, such as Kam Pek Paradise Casino.

item.title: IAM / Portal | Update eliminates about 20 years of statistics
item.description:
By eliminating the data, AMI caused access to information as to the one that reveals that in 2023 and 2024 there was a peak of animal slaughter. HM tried to get clarification, but had no answer yet
The Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMI) updated the portal with data on the number of animals slaughtered and took the opportunity to fail to present the statistics of about 20 years. HM tried to get clarification on the reason for eliminating the data, but despite an email sent to four advisers on May 25, until yesterday I had not received any response, nor even confirmation of receiving email. In the past, before the recent update, those who visited the AMI portal about the number of slaughtered animals could not only realize the number of dogs of dogs and cats per month, but also had access to a history over 20 years. The older data between 2003 and 2007 were less complete, as they only had the total of animals slaughtered without discrimination if the animals were canine or feline. However, all these data are no longer available, without providing any explanation of the decision to stop making the data available to the population. In addition, according to the new presentation, it is no longer possible to follow the trends in the slaughtering of animals in the territory. This is due to the fact that they would have started to present the data by quarter instead of presenting per month. General cleaning The elimination of data arises at a time when the government argues to be implementing a policy of “capture, sterilization and adoption” of street animals rather than resorting to slaughter. This was a policy requested for several years by animal protection associations as an alternative to the number of slaughter. However, between 2023 and 2024 the number of slaughter grew. The elimination of the data also makes the peak of feline deaths disappeared from the statistics recorded in the first half of 2023, when only 105 cats were slaughtered in six months. In terms of canine deaths, the elimination of statistics shows how the year with the highest number of slaughter was 2024, last year, when AMI eliminated a total of 311 dogs. However, this number is less than half of what was happening in 2010, the year with the highest canine mortality according to the statistics erased by the AMI, when 718 occurrences were recorded. In light of the new official statistics, the number of cat slaughter in 2023 and 2024 was 140 and 119, respectively. In terms of dogs, the numbers show a climb, with 220 slaughter in 2023 and 311 slaughter in 2024. In the first half of the year, there were 32 cat slaughter and 69 dogs.

item.title: Neto Valente fears that Portuguese community loses influence
item.description: Heard by TDM Radio Macau, Jorge Neto Valente, lawyer and president of the founding of the Portuguese Macao School (FEPM) said it is “time to question how long it will be necessary for the influence of the Portuguese to completely disappear [in Macau]”. These words were uttered taking into account the growing difficulties in obtaining residence, although, according to the basic law, citizens with Portuguese nationality have the right to residence. Neto Valente spoke to the radio in the context of the June 10 celebrations - Portugal Day, Camões and the Portuguese Communities. "For Portuguese culture there is no better than having Portuguese. When we are watching the departure of some Portuguese, the disappearance [of them] by emigration or death of Portuguese who are not replaced because the difficulty of bringing Portuguese to Macau has been increasing, it is time to interrogate how long it will be necessary for the influence of the Portuguese to disappear completely," he said. For the former president of the Macao Lawyers Association, “it is not the Chinese who learn Portuguese and very well, and they are valid, talented people, but they are not the ones who will bring the culture, who will promote Portuguese culture in Macao”, saying that it all depends on the “political decision” to define the future of this scenario. In this way, Neto Valente asks for a "vision", which draws an "obvious path", because otherwise "Macau is diluting, loses his identity, is no longer Macao." He also said he believed that there will be, on the part of the authorities, "sufficient discernment and vision." Qualified lack Also heard by TDM Radio Macau, Maria Amelia António, president of the House of Portugal in Macao, stressed that “since I started to face this new situation that has worried me a lot, and it is more and more concerned” the growing departure of Portuguese and the non -renewal of the community. "How do you make omelets without eggs?" He asked, stressing how Macau can "be a point of diffusion of the Portuguese language and a pole of difference, as China wants, if you do not have the necessary ingredients for this statement?". And leaves a concrete example of the lack of technicians for the House of Portugal School of Arts and Crafts, felt with the departure of Portuguese. "There have been a lot of qualified people and we miss the many activities we have done. There are professions that are not academic, and I give an example: I need technicians who know how to move the ceramic ovens," he said.

item.title: SMG | New Tropical Storm in three days

item.title: Chinese company builds access to Inhambane and Porto da Beira
item.description: Mozambican Transport and Logistics Minister João Jorge Matlombe told Lusa that Mozambique will sign contracts with a Chinese company to build access roads to Inhambá and Porto da Beira. Matlombe explained that he will sign the contracts today, one involving “direct financing” and another a public-private partnership (PPP), with the China Road and Bridge Corporation (CRBC) state group. CRBC will build a road with almost 78 kilometers to improve access to Inhambane province in southern Mozambique, which the minister described as “an important tourist zone”. Matlombe has assumed that the cost of the project "will even be assumed by the state itself", since "there is no demand that justifies a PPP or a direct direct investment." On the contrary, the leader argued that, according to a study already conducted, ”the road to Porto da Beira,“ from the point of view of the business model, allows any investor to recover his investment ”. The minister stressed that Porto da Beira“ is one of the largest in the south of the country ”and that the new access will be“ an alternative corridor ”that will facilitate, for example,“ the departure of Porto ”for the vicin. Encounters in Macau The minister spoke on the sidelines of a session of the 16th International Forum and Exhibition on Investment Investment and Construction (IIICF), which is taking place until Thursday in Macao. Matlombe has revealed that he already has at least five meetings in Macao with members of the government of Botsuana, Angola, Cape Verde and Democratic Republic of Congo (RDCongo). On the table will be the logistics corridor in the North Zone, which connects Maláui, Zambia and RDCongo, to “capitalize the use of the port of Nacala”, said the leader. Matlombe revealed that the Minister of Public Works, Housing and Mozambican Water Resources, Fernando Rafael, also traveled to the region. The head of the protection of transport and logistics said that during the stay in Macao, the government colleague "will also sign some agreements for the social housing mass for young people."

item.title: Commerce | Prolonged until December anti -dumping inquiry on European pork meat
item.description: The China Ministry of Commerce announced yesterday that it will last until December the investigation for unfair competition to imports of certain pig meat products from the European Union (EU), which began in June 2024. In a statement published in its official portal, the ministry justified the extent of the investigation “meeting the complexity of the case”, setting as a new deadline December 16. The inquiry, launched on June 17, 2024, initially had a one -year duration, with the possibility of extension “in special circumstances”, as it had already been signaled at the time. The investigation focuses on pork and offal, both refrigerated and frozen, as well as fat and derivatives, originating in the EU. Beijing began this measure as retaliation for customs imposed by Brussels on electric vehicles manufactured in China, claiming that state subsidies received by this sector create competition distortions against European brands. Despite tensions, in recent months there was a slight approximation between China and the EU, namely after the impact of the trade war began by US President Donald Trump. European Commerce Commissioner Maros Sefcovic, who visited China in March, recently said that Brussels and Beijing "share significant mutual interests in resolving bilateral and global challenges" and stressed that it is "equally important to face differences." According to the European official, the two parties are “working hard” to achieve advances before the bilateral summit scheduled for July, China, when the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between Beijing and Brussels will be celebrated.

item.title: Kenya | Country studies with China investment in the creation of vaccine factories
item.description: Quenia and China started talks to the creation of vaccine and drug production centers in the African country, a project valued at $ 500 million, Kennian authorities said Monday. Kenyan Health Minister Aden Duale held a "strategic meeting" with a Chinese delegation led by Asian country's ambassador in Kenya, Guo Haiyan, to discuss the establishment of local vaccine production centers and pharmaceuticals with Chinese technology, the Kenya Ministry of Health said in a statement. The initiative aims to “strengthen Kenya supply chains, reduce dependence on imports, create employment according to the government's development agenda” and position Kenya as a continental leader in the process of manufacturing sanitary products, a vision that is expected to become reality by 2028 with the support of the Chinese government, the department of Duale explained. The Kenyan Minister also welcomed China's offering of 500 scholarships and 20 annual exchange programs, considering it a key investment for Kenya's future leadership in this sector.

item.title: USA | Chinese students face uncertainties about studying in the country
item.description:
Despite Trump's statements that the US “loves to receive Chinese students,” the number of refusals of young Chinese is increasing
He Qixuan, a student of Shanghai, rejoiced with joy when last Friday answered Lusa's call and said that his visa to study in the United States had been approved. “I'm going to celebrate! It's the first step to studying abroad!” The young candidate for the master's degree in emerging media studies at the University of Boston told Lusa after an interview at the US consulate in Shanghai, where, like her, in the same line, almost 200 candidates waiting for interviews were approved. If the scene seems to illustrate the commitment made by the US President in the telephone conversation with Chinese counterparts, Xi Jinping last Thursday-and shape Donald Trump's statement that the US “loves to receive Chinese students”-Washington's signs on the subject are more than contradictory, from the perspective of several Chinese sources in statements to Lusa. The Yi Si agency, headquartered in Guangzhou, specializing in the support of Chinese students who want to study abroad, accounts for the growing concern with the rejection of visas among candidates who resort to their services. "I have two students from the Macao University of Science and Technology to whom they were denied the visas to study in the United States now three times," the agency director Christ Feng told Lusa, noting that the US consulate "has not provided any reasons" for rejections. "During Trump's previous presidency, it was the computer students who faced the highest rejection rates, but now the candidates of all specialties risk being refused," Feng added. Aggressive refusal Xiangning Wu, an associate professor at the University of Macao's Department of Government and Public Policies, told Lusa that, in recent years, their number of students studying in the United States "has been decreasing due to" increased bribes "and" safety reasons. " Wu also mentioned that visa refusals have mostly targeted science and engineering students, which has made these students ended Hong Kong and Singapore. Descriptions seem to find resonance in what US Secretary of State Marco Rubio announced in a statement on the eve of the call between Trump and Xi last week. According to the state department's statement, the United States will begin to "aggressively revoke" the visas granted to Chinese students, and the measure will focus on students with calls to the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) and those in the United States to study in sensitive areas. "Under the leadership of President Trump, the State Department will work with the internal security department to aggressively revoke the visas granted to Chinese students, including those with calls to the Chinese Communist Party or studying in critical areas," Rubio said. "We will also review the visa grant criteria to increase the scrutiny of all future visa requests from the Popular Republic of China and Hong Kong," added the US Secretary of State. Homemade This determination was heard with due attention in China. The Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ) in Macau told Lusa that he is preparing to “watch” about 200 students from the Special Chinese administrative region to study in the United States, as well as others who want to continue their studies. "The DSEDJ has reported with third parties in Macau and asked them to be aware of the latest developments and provide the necessary facilitation and assistance to students in the United States, or who want to study in the United States, with the aim of moving to other countries," the institution said in a statement sent to Lusa. In the school year 2022/2023, the total number of Chinese students in the United States was 289,526, representing approximately 27.4 percent of the total number of US international students, and heading for the 14th year, according to the Open Doors, funded by the US State Department. Jing Wu, Lusa

item.title: Tokyo | Chinese aircraft carrier entered waters from Japan
item.description: The Japan Ministry of Defense revealed yesterday that a Chinese and remaining fleet aircraft carrier entered waters from the Japanese exclusive economic zone last Saturday at a time of tensions in the relationship between the two countries. According to the Japanese Defense Ministry, the aircraft carrier Liaoning, two guided missile resetters and a fast refueling ship sailed about 300 kilometers from the easterniest point of Japan, Minamitori Island on Saturday. According to a statement, after Liaoning and the accompanying ships had left the Japanese ZEE, they performed on Sunday to take off and landing exercises of fighters and helicopters. The Japanese Ministry of Defense said it highlighted a ship to the area to follow the situation. This was the first time a Chinese aircraft carrier has entered this part of Japan's EEE in the Pacific Ocean, a ministry spokesman told France-Presse news agency. "We believe that Chinese military is trying to improve their operational capabilities and their ability to conduct operations in remote areas," he added. China's growing military presence and the use of naval and air means to claim disputed territories are worrying the United States and its allies in the Asia-Pacific region. Government spokesman Yoshimasa Hayashi said yesterday at a press conference that the Japanese government "conveyed an appropriate message to the Chinese part," without specifying whether he had presented a formal protest.

item.title: Hong Kong | Executive maintains connection to the US dollar
item.description: Hong Kong's chief executive guaranteed an excerpt from an interview released yesterday that he will keep the local currency linked to the US dollar despite the trade war between Washington and Beijing. In an interview with Hong Kong South China Morning Post, John Lee Ka-Chiu said the indexing of the local dollar to the US currency has been "one of the factors fundamental to the region's success." Since 1983, even before the UK administration transition to China, that the Hong Kong dollar is linked exclusively to the US currency and can float in a range between 7.75 and 7.85 units per dollar. Something that also means that the territory's financial regulator, the monetary authority of Hong Kong (HKMA), follows the uphill and fall rates of the reference interest rate imposed by the United States federal reserve. In May, HKMA had to intervene several times in the market, buying a total of US $ 16.7 billion to weaken local currency. This after the Hong Kong dollar has reached the top limit of the fluctuation range due to the appreciation of Asian currencies and increasing investment in listed actions in the city's stock market. In addition to foreign investors, continental China investors have bought more local actions, in part thanks to a mechanism, launched in 2014, which connects the Hong Kong and Shanghai scholarships, Chinese 'financial capital'. In an interview with the third anniversary of his administration, John Lee denied that the financial system depends solely on the US dollar connection. The chief executive has promised to create more financial products to reinforce the role of Hong Kong as the world's largest center for mainstream China Business, Renminbi.

item.title: Economy | Register deflation for the fourth consecutive month in May
item.description: The Consumer Price Index (IPC), the main indicator of inflation in China, fell for the fourth consecutive month in May, down 0.1 percent in homologous terms, the same amount recorded in April and March. Still, the indicator, released yesterday by the National Statistics Office (NBS) of the Asian country, suffered a less sharp drop than the predictions of most analysts, who expected a 0.2 percent decrease. On the other hand, analysts expected prices to keep at the same level as April, but the monthly trend in May was also negative: consumer prices fell 0.2 percent over the fourth month of 2025. The risk of deflation in China, the second largest economy in the world, worsened last year, raised by a deep real estate crisis, which affected investment and consumption. Deflation consists of a drop in prices over time, as opposed to a climb (inflation). The phenomenon reflects weakness in domestic consumption and investment and is particularly dangerous, as a drop in the price of assets, as a rule of credit, generates an imbalance between the value of loans and bank guarantees. Dong Lijuan, NBS statistical, preferred to stress that underlying inflation - a measure that eliminates the effect of food and energy prices due to their volatility - rose 0.6 percent, in homologous terms. "The IPC went from discharge to a drop in monthly comparison, mainly due to the fall in energy prices," explained the expert, who insisted that "policies to increase consumption continue to be effective, as prices in some areas have had positive variations." China's authorities have repeatedly underlined in recent months that boosting poor internal demand is one of the main economic priorities for 2025, which has been marked by the US trade war.

item.title: Exports go up less than expected under the influence of the trade war
item.description: China's exports increased less than expected in May, according to official statistics revealed yesterday, reverberating the volume of goods sent to the US in the middle of trade war. According to Chinese customs, exports increased 4.8 percent in homologous terms last month. The amount was below the predictions of the economists inquired by the Bloomberg Financial News Agency, who expected a growth of 6 percent. After Geneva in May, Americans and Chinese yesterday began a new round of conversations in London, with the aim of prolonging the commercial truce and reaching a lasting agreement on reducing the custom customs supervised. Chinese exports to the United States totaled $ 28.8 billion in May, compared to $ 33 billion in April, a record of a drop of 12.7 percent. On the other hand, Chinese exports to Vietname increased slightly in May, reaching $ 17.3 billion. Uncertain future “The trade war between China and the United States has led to a sharp drop in exports to the US, but this was offset by an increase in exports to other countries,” writes Zhang Zhiwei, an economist at Pinpoint Asset Management, in a note. "Commercial perspectives remain very uncertain at this stage" and problems may arise "as the anticipation effect fades," Zhang noted, referring to foreign buyers who had increased Chinese products in anticipation of possible increases in the United States. In the other trade scale dish, Chinese imports fell 3.4 percent in May, reflecting the weak demand and the growing commercial pressures about the world's second largest economy. The Sino-American talks in London will mark the second formal negotiations between the two countries, since US President Donald Trump launched a global commercial offensive in April. On the American side, the delegation will include Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, Trade Secretary Howard Lutnick, and White House commercial representative Jamieson Greer. As in Geneva, Chinese vice-master-master, he Lifeng, leads the Beijing delegation. These discussions follow a telephone exchange on Thursday between Donald Trump and Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping, which the president of the United States described as "very positive."

item.title: Currency | Brazil prepares unprecedented emission of public debt in Yuan in China
item.description:
The trade war launched by Donald Trump increasingly leads countries to seek alternatives to the US dollar
Brazil aims to issue sovereign debt titles in the Chinese market later this year, in an unprecedented operation, when President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva reinforces commercial and investment ties with China. Brasilia plans to issue titles called Chinese currency, Yuan, in the mainland China capital market, and also wants to return to the market of obligations called euros, yesterday revealed the deputy secretary of the Ministry of Finance, Dario Durigan, quoted by the British newspaper Financial Times. "The idea is that this year, we will make a new sustainable emission in dollars, such as last year, as well as emissions in Europe and 'Panda obligations' in China," Durigan said in an interview with FT. "The European Union wants to negotiate with Brazil the expansion of bilateral trade, both in terms of transactions and also enabling Brazil the option of issuing debt in Europe," he added. "The same can happen to China," he said. The Brazilian government has been reinforcing commercial ties with Brussels and consolidating Beijing relations in a context of the trade war launched by US President Donald Trump. The South American Block Mercosur, of which Brazil is part, expects the long-awaited trade agreement with the European Union to be approved by the end of the year. On Thursday, Lula met with French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris and appealed to Paris's support to the deal. Macron has resisted the ratification of the treaty, the target of strong opposition by French farmers. Plans to issue sovereign debt titles in China come at a time when the Brazilian government seeks to attract more investment in the Asian country, which is by far the largest commercial partner in Brazil. China is also trying to reinforce its economic influence on Latin America. Operation will also test the appetite of international investors for Brazilian debt, in a context of growing skepticism in the face of Lula's economic policy, which has bet on the largest state role in the economy to boost growth and reduce inequality. The strategy of increasing expense has generated criticism between entrepreneurs who accuse the government to aggravate inflation, raise interest rates and endanger the sustainability of public debt. Market game This week, Brazil placed $ 1.5 billion in obligations to five years with a interest rate of 5.68 percent and $ 1.25 billion due to ten years to 6.73 percent in the second offshore debt issuance by 2025. Funding costs in Brazil increased after the Central Bank raised the director rate to 14.75 percent in an attempt to contain inflation. Critics accuse Brasilia's executive not to act firmly to resolve the chronic budget deficit and debt growth. Moody's agency raised Brazil's long -term rating last October to a level of investment degree, which allowed access to the cheapest capital. However, in May, the agency reviewed the positive for stable perspective, quoting slower progress than expected in budget policy.

item.title: Rui Leão, architect and co-author of “Layering the City” | A four -hand city
